Reviews.Title: “Best service experience ever”
Reviews.Author: ParsippanyGirl
Reviews.Content: As long as you like your bed a little on the hard side, this is an excellent choice for visiting LA tourist destinations. We stayed here for our first trip to the city and it is a great starting out point to drive to all things to do. The manager and all desk staff are very professional and helpful. They truly care if you are enjoying your stay which can hardly be said at most hotels these days. The breakfast and nightly reception made it an even more pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: TwoContinentsLeft
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful, the breakfast was varied & good, and we could walk to shopping destinations at night (we're not really the bar crowd, so it was perfect). We rented a car just for a day & the staff arranged every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for honeymoon stay in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Richard J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon (June 28th - July 1st 2011) - the last three nights of a California/Nevada road trip. Concierge took charge of our car and check-in was quick. I had mentioned that we were staying as part of our honeymoon and were upgraded to a suite and had a wonderful heart made out of petals on our bed. The room had a balcony over an inner courtyard, it was a good size and had all the usual amenities, basket of products to buy, fridge, lcd tv etc. and it had a comfy bed and no external noise issues that bothered us. The location was great - on our first morning the hotel staff gave us a map to get a bus tour which was a block down at the Beverly Centre. From here we could access everywhere we needed on a 2 day pass. Breakfasts were plentiful and I loved the evening wine and cheese. There was also a launderette nearby which was great for us as we needed to wash our clothes before heading on for the final leg of our journey. They also offered us late checkout as our flights were not until the evening which was a bonus. I would highly recommend the hotel for anyone needing a clean well located and well run hotel on a modest budget in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel with great vibes!”
Reviews.Author: Susie F
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I have ever written a review on tripadvisor, but felt compelled to recommend the Elan Hotel for their excellent service. My husband and I recently stayed 3 nights at the Elan Hotel while visiting our daughter and her family in the La Brea area of LA, and will definitely stay there again on our future visits. I found the Elan on tripadvisor and read all of the reviews. The Elan Hotel really is a gem with great ambiance, good location, and most importantly a wonderful staff and terrific management. We stayed on the first floor in a room in the rear of the building with a king size bed. The room wasn't large, but very quiet and the bed quite comfortable. We both thought the continental breakfasts were great. They included a lovely and sufficient assortment of fresh pastries, muffins, bagels, cereals, granola, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffees,teas and fresh fruit that were adequately replenished. We also especially enjoyed the wine and cheese receptions in the afternoons (nice variety of quality wines and cheeses) in a setting conducive to meeting other guests and socializing. The staff was all extremely friendly and very helpful – remembering our names and inquiring about our needs - we’d rate them exceptional. Michael is such a sweetheart! Valet service for parking was also great. The rooms were very clean and the bed was really comfortable. As another reviewer noted - We also especially liked the chocolates on the pillow at night and the card showing the next day's weather forecast. “Thanks” to the Elan for a great stay and “Thanks” to the tripadvisor reviewers for steering us to the Elan!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: Our staff was just perfect at this hotel to celebrate a special occasion. Michael on the front desk was very helpful with all our needs.The room was clean & quiet & has everything you need. The daily breakfast was very good & the nightly wine & cheese was a nice touch. The hotel is within walking distance to The Beverly Center & The Grove & the buses stop right outside & takes very little time to get you to the sights of Hollywood. There are also plenty of great cafes & restaurants nearby. I really recommend The Elan Hotel for its location and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't look that great from the outside, but it is a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: malm1959
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not large, but they are very comfortable. We loved the soap with the middle cut out. Also the free candy in the candy jar was a nice touch. The wine and cheese at night is greatly appreciated. Breakfast buffet was good. The location is good because you can work to the grove- it is a little far, but at least you can walk there if you like. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very well managed”
Reviews.Author: docirish
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great area, 3rd street is only a short walk away with lots of funky boutiques and restaurants, very well managed, staff very eager to please, helpful and informative, rooms are clean and fully stocked. Omar and Michael at reception were excellent. Valet parking was available. For the price a great hotel, a great find. Definitely give it a try

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Beverly Center/Cedars Sinai area”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous258
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the ELAN Hotel, and loved it. Our room was tastefully decorated, and the bed linens were superb. We had a restful night's sleep in absolute QUIET---a rarity (in our experience) for a hotel on such a busy street as Beverly Blvd. in West Hollywood. The staff were marvelous and the breakfast very good. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated, and all in all, the ambiance is excellent. Reception staff is always friendly and helpful, and the rates are good. I recommend calling the hotel for the best rate available, as their website did not offer the best rate, which we got after calling them. We definitely would return again, should we need a nice, quiet, beautiful and reasonable place to stay in the West Hollywood area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and so close to BH”
Reviews.Author: frank b
Reviews.Content: I stayed her just one night and thought it was so much better them similarly priced hotels in LA. Super cool location and a short taxi ride the BH and sunset strip. I have to stay here again next time I am in LA and get the real VIBE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarsBar68
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are so true. The staff are exceptional. Reception staff always smiled and greeted us, showed genuine interest in our days out and were so helpful. Valet service was excellent. Breakfast although a little limited in choice was plentiful in supply and fresh. Between 5.00pm and 7.00pm is complimentary cheese and wine which was superb. We particularly enjoyed the Monkey Bay Sauvignon Blanc. The rooms were clean and well proportioned. The only criticism we had was the size of beds. We stayed in a standard double room and the width of the beds are limited. We have subsequently discovered that you need to book at least a Queen size bed when staying in California. Free wifi was great too. The hotel is conveniently placed for restaurants within walking distance and a short drive to the major Hollywood attractions. We were travelling with our 9 year old son who enjoyed looking out of the window during breakfast at all the expensive cars going past. If you are going to LA, this hotel must be in your short list.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: gwall60
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at Elan Hotel over spring break. I read great reviews of Elan Hotel on Tripadvisor, and the Elan Hotel lives up to and exceeds the expectations. The continental breakfasts were perfect, as were the wine and cheese receptions in the afternoons. The staff was great. Valet service for parking was friendly and exceptional. The staff at the front desk was happy to give me directions in the morning to where I was going. When we came to the Hotel in the evenings, there was always a friendly greeting. You feel like the staff knows your name at Elan Hotel. The maid staff was excellent and friendly. I especially liked the chocolates on the pillow at night, the music turned to classical music, and the card showing the next day's weather forecast, and all the candles in the evening in the lobby. Elan Hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Super great location.”
Reviews.Author: polished_pink
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little gem. Great location, affordable, clean, super nice staff. Breakfast provided well done. Will stay here again. Only issue, not the hotels fault was the Just Tires store blasts their music at the crack of dawn. Could here that with closed windows. Try to get a room not facing that store.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in W. Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: fritzie0461
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Elan recently was, as expected, wonderful! The hotel and its staff certainly deserve one of the top three spots in your ratings for L.A. hotels. Every need is met! If you are looking for a pleasant, clean, and happy place to stay in L.A. this is the place for you. My husband and I visited L.A. to check off one of our retirement "bucket list" items, that is to go on the "Price is Right" and yes, I won!!! It was all in all a dream come true including our three nights at the Elan!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy stay”
Reviews.Author: SonnyPM
Reviews.Content: The Elan is a great little hotel. The room and bathroom had everything needed for a comfortable two day stay. The staff was pleasant and provided great directions and arranged for a taxi promptly and with a smile. The free internet worked great and the free breakfast was fantastic. The Beverly Center was accross the street so that is convenient if you have some time and want to shop. I would recommend this hotel to pretty much anyone looking for a clean, happy place to stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in West Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Dede C
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the great reviews I found on Trip Advisor. The location was excellent. We especially enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese bar nightly. The King suite was spacious and had 2 flat screen tv's!! Don't miss Jan's Restaurant across the streeet and the sushi bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nick H
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to numerous parts of the world, but this Hotel is at the top of the list of the places I've stayed at.The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms updated, the beds comfortable and the service is great.The service staff is wonderful---helpful, thoughtful, courteous and very knowledgeable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great service away from the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things Can Come in Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: FlowerladyVirginia
Reviews.Content: Finding a convenient, well-run, well-appointed, reasonably priced small hotel in LA is a challenge, but the Elan meets it and will likely be my go-to hotel whenever I visit. Located on Beverly Blvd. in the Fairfax neighborhood of the city, this two floor hotel is within walking distance of the famed Farmers Market and adjacent upscale Mall, many wonderful local non-chain restaurants and interesting shops. The rooms are not particularly spacious, but they are clean and well-equipped, down to the magnifying mirror I always look for in a bathroom! The flat screen TV, free WiFi and IPod clock at bedside are all welcome and the free morning breakfast buffet and wine "happy hour" each afternoon are also attractive features at this hotel. I found the desk staff to be welcoming, helpful and friendly. I would change only two things if I had the power: I would add a pillow top mattress cover to the beds - they are very hard...and I would upgrade to the curved shower curtain rods to make the in-tub shower feel more spacious. Also, if you have a car, street parking is sparse, so valet parking (@$24 a day) is an added expense. None of these issues will keep me away from coming back, though!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: heather154913
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research before deciding on this hotel because Los Angeles is so big and I had never been there before. I went with my daughter for a shopping and hanging out together trip. The hotel is small which adds to its charm. It is clean and the room was very good. The front desk staff were very helpful and personable. Check in was a breeze. It is set up well- you can easily take the elevator or the stairs as it is only 2 stories. The room was quite large, it had a king size bed, comfy pillows, a desk, flat screen tv and free wifi including 2 computers with a printer on the main floor to access. The bathroom was extremely clean the only downfall was a small counter space around the sink making it hard to put much on it. We heard a bit of traffic but no real noise, it was quite quiet. They offer continental breakfast in the morning which was great- it included a variety of bagel, cream cheese, jam, sometimes bread, different types of yogurt, bananas, oranges and apples and hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee and tea as well as baked items like muffins and danish. It was all fresh and clean. There was tables to eat at and take in the news. The good thing was it didn't matter if you got there at the beginning or toward the end, it was replenished. It was great to stat the day. They also had wine and cheese in the evening- red and white with crackers and cheese which also was replenished . Both were a serve yourself which worked out great. Very good set up for this. They also had juice and water in the evening to help yourself to in the same area. All of this was great. We did rent a car and it seemed there was no where around the hotel to park yourself , so we had to valet park . The gentleman who manned this very all personable and helpful. The cost for this was $24.00 a day which seemed like alot but overall seemed standard. There was never a delay for your car, it worked out well just seemed like a lot of money. The hotel itself is a short walk from the Beverly Center, about 4 blocks, which has some shopping and eating. There is a CVS pharmacy across from the Beverly center. Not far from the hotel is another shopping and eating area, called the Grove and the Farmers Market. Great shopping and food here, well worth taking in. It is about a 5-10 min drive from the hotel . You definately need a car if you want to take in Hollywood attractions and Rodeo drive etc. Overall I was very pleased with this hotel- friendly staff, a smaller environment, great breakfast and wine reception and clean. Very affordable and good value. Easy to get to and find.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Elan Hotel and I was impressed. I have stayed two blocks west at the Sofitel and paid almost twice as much. I have also stayed up on Sunset at the London West Hollywood and paid well over $340/night. The rooms are comparable to these pricey hotels. I had an Executive King and found it well decorated with crisp sheets and large, fluffy towels, a robe, slippers, coffee pot, mini bar and a great flat screen TV. The room was quiet and very clean. The location is undeniably great - two blocks to the Beverly Center, about six blocks to the Grove and there is an amazing number of good local restaurants within walking distance - try the Kings Road Cafe for a fabulous latte and delicious breakfast or Swinger's Diner for just about anything. All in all, a great value. I only had the complimentary breakfast once as it was typical cereal, bland muffins, bagels, juice, coffee. The wine reception was the only thing I can honestly say was not good. They served only two choices of wine, a Cabernet Sauvignon and a Sauvignon Blanc. Both were brands you'd find in the lowest shelf at your local grocery store - really bad stuff. The crackers and cheese were rather skimpy. But, hey, it was free. The reason you pay big bucks for the Sofitel is two things - the "name" and the swanky bar. You pay even bigger bucks for the London W Hollywood because of location, the architecture (which is pretty cool) and the Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Not to mention, both have pools and fitness centers. But if you just want a clean, well run establishment, no restaurant, bar, etc....the Elan Hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great repeat performance!”
Reviews.Author: smdubowsky
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth or fifth time at this hotel and it did not disappoint. Renovations are finally complete and there is new bedding in the rooms. The staff is very friendly and they now remember us! The continental breakfasts are great and they even have Vegemite for the Aussies. The location near the Beverly Center is ideal and the rates are very reasonable compared to nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel077
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel in a safe locale of LA. FANTASTIC hotel with great value for a LA stop over as breakfast and evening drinks/cheese included in rate. Wonderful staff who are always willing to help with all queries. We also needed a hotel close to shops to do some last minute shopping before flying home to Sydney. The doorman at the hotel is wonderful (I forgot his name) and after talking to him about what we want to achieve out of our stay in LA, he recommended we checked out Marshalls. Located opposite the hotel was a Marshalls (similar to a BigW/Kmart but with all designer labels!), I was able to purchase a Medium-Large Samsonite suitcase for $55USD to buy all my goodies to take home as a second suitcase. We also purchased CK, DKNY, Nine West, Tommy Hilfiger and other branded consumerables from the store. Also opposite the hotel is The Beverly Centre with ALL shops imaginable; Tiffanies, Sephora, H&M, Zara?, and many other US brands. CVS pharmacy also located opposite the hotel, great to stock up on makeup and other items. We also had a car which we Valet’d with the hotel to drive to the Kodak Theatre/ Santa Monica/Getty Centre/ Hollywood sign/downtown. Prompt turn around with Valet. 2-3 days max in LA would be sufficient for any first time traveller with limited time. We will return to this hotel if in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vossScottsdale
Reviews.Content: This hotel brings service to a new level.My husband and I spent two nights in the Executive King room, second floor overlooking Beverly Blvd. Could not hear any noise on the street except a fire truck which past by. We had our choice of a sunny 2nd floor room or a shadowy 1st floor room away from the street toward the back. Breakfast and wine and cheese reception are included in the price. Valet parking is great and quick. This hotel is committed to being green and clean. The staff was always very pleasant and very informative about what was around the hotel.Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and Beverly Center Mall is down the street (easy walk) and provides a great view of the Hollywood Sign from the Food Court Patio. Jerry's Deli provides room service for this hotel, but after a six hour drive we opted to walk. We were delighted with the variety and quality of food served at this restaurant. There are a variety of local and chain restaurants very close by. Ralph's grocery store and Bristol Farms Grocery is an easy walk past the Beverly Center. Our experience at this hotel was the best and will stay here again when the opportunity to visit LA comes again. Thank you Elan Hotel for a great stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Love this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris9111948
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at this hotel over the last 3 years and it only gets better! The location is great, near The Beverly Center, The Grove, great restaurants. Breakfast and a wine reception are included. The latter is complete with several cheeses, crackers, nuts, sliced meat white and red wine. Breakfast includes bagel, pastry, hot and cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice and boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: juanclem
Reviews.Content: Patients of Cedars-Sinai Medical Center are given a list of hotels near their facilities, one of which was the Elan Hotel. Hotels in Beverly Hills, CA are not known for their inexpensive prices. However, mention you are a patient of the medical center when calling the Elan and you will receive a nice discount. Upon the moment we arrived, the staff enthusiastically greeted us, especially Michael Kim, with a friendly smile and helpful hand. Our room was on the back side of the hotel and was small but very clean and up-to-date. The wine reception was the best we have encountered and the continental breakfasts were above the normal fare. Overall, our experience at this hotel could not have been better and we will definitely stay here again should the occasion arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for LA!”
Reviews.Author: Loopylis_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel succesfully punches above it's weight. We were here for 3 nights in Dec with another family group. Staff are extremely friendly and always willing to help (arranging a great deal on a large vehicle for 24hr hire inc parking). More than adequate breakfast and certainly better than we have had in other more highly star rated hotels (& it's included in the price). Rooms/beds were a little small but this was no great inconvenience. We appreciated the turn down service & a card advising us of the following day's weather. Rooms were always cleaned to an exceptionally high standard. The wine & cheese service was great! We did take over the lobby a bit in the evenings as we were 4 adults, 2 teenagers & a 7 y/o so it was impossible to contain us in our rooms for any great length of time. We were able to set out food & drinks for ourselves which was ideal for our family setting. The free internet and very up to date computers (free to use & very speedy) was fantastic. Located close to the Beverly Centre & an easy 15min stroll to The Grove. Our only downside was that we were told by a staff member that it was just a short 20min walk to Rodeo Dve....NO IT ISN'T! It is about an hour to walk but you would be much better advised to catch a bus which drops you very close by. We would happily stay here again as the room rate was excellent especially compared with other hotels nearby and we were more than pleased with the staff and the hotel itself.....well done everyone at the Elan, you show great pride in your work and this is reflected in the service you provide to your customers & the great feedback you receive in return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: emem
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable hotel we stayed at for 3 nights. We arrived very early am on an International flight and were accommodated in a room and offerred complimentary breakfast, until our Suite was available. Breakfast included in the room rate adequately met our needs, with complimentary wine and cheese early evening. Front desk staff helped secure tickets to a local concert. All staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: dalexcg
Reviews.Content: I was with my boy (14 years old), and we just had a great time at the Elan Hotel. The guys at the front desk were friendly and they allways had very usefull information. The hotel was clean, with a very good location. The breakfast was not the best of the hotel, but enough to begin the day. Maybe my only complain is that the room I had was a little bit noisy, because it was located at the ground floor, and I could hear people passing by. I totally recommend it. If you want to have a great time at LA, stay at Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bluespoetryman
Reviews.Content: I'd gladly stay at the Elan Hotel again because it meets the appeal of comfort versus good value admirably. Our room was adequate sized, with bathrobe, slippers and copious snacks and beverages. The 5:00PM wine and cheese was a great touch, done nicer that expected, as was an ample free breakfast of many quality choices. If you need more, there are good places to eat within walking distance. Hat's off to all the staff who were generously friendly and professional. A excess of mild noise in our hallway in the morning precluded sleeping in, so in the future I would avoid the hallway directly behind the main desk. Great location of course, close to many attractions of the area. This one's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mel≠d
Reviews.Content: Great hotel I chose this through Trip Advisor and was not disappointed The staff were fantastic The rooms were pleasant - a little small when the lounge was converted into a bed but aok as we spent most time at the Beverly Centre anyway! Walk to farmers markets and the grove was about 15 mins (ambling) Breakfast was awesome and there was even vegemite (much appreciated) Wonderful place, will stay here again Transport in LA was organised by William at this hotel (even from LAX to our disney hotel) and Cesar was a great and pleasant driver!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: WAussie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a 4 week holiday and it will be our first stop when we plan our next trip. We had stayed at a number of hotels and thought this one was right up there with more expensive accommodation We found checkin very personal , easy and quick, we had arrived at three previous hotels with a broken suitcase and this was the first one who actually took 10 minutes to help us fix it. We loved all the extra touches , the turndown service, card with details of the next days weather , free Internet, breakfast and the wine and cheese nights. We had booked the junior suite which was still very reasonably priced.it was huge,spotlessly clean and was the only hotel in 4 weeks where we had a coffee pot, bottle opener and all the little things you might need Location is fantastic for Beverley centre,the grove and the hop on hop off bus Thanks for a fantastic finish to our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Second time happy guest”
Reviews.Author: atacoatemybaby
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Elan Hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in LA. The Elan is about a 20 minute drive from LAX and as everyone says, it is across the road from the Beverly Center and a five minute drive from the Farmer's Market and the Grove shopping complex. The rooms are not huge, but neither would I call them small. I asked for a quiet room and I was given an accessible room facing the courtyard, so it was bigger than the norm for obvious reasons. The breakfast was simple, but more than enough and as always, the customer service was exceptional (Michael at the front counter was friendly and professional when checking me in) and I didn't wait long for my car to be brought out. People complain about having to pay extra for parking, but I can only assume they haven't stayed at most hotels in LA before, because almost all of them make you pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff , good service , small room”
Reviews.Author: RobEugeneOr
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay as my wife was a patient at Cedars Sinai Hospital , they gave a rate for the Hospital . The breakfast was good and the wine social was fun . The rooms are clean and well kept but very small , there is a communal microwave downstairs that was dirty . Overall adequate , but not great , however it was very convenient for our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel but very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: marishka21au
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LA Elan for a 4 days and could not be happier. WIth having basic set up as a hotel the staff was very friendly, providing complimentary breakfast as well as afternoon wine and cheese platers. It is fantastic stay close to everything. I would highly recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Modest room, kind staff, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gidget2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I needed to be at the Bev.Center for work. The location is very convenient for that purpose. I got in very late and the staff was very accommodating. My room was on the first floor, and didn't have any windows- only a sliding door that led out to an awkward walkway for the valets.. so I had to keep the shades shut the whole time in case someone would walk by. So I felt like it was dungeon-like. The continental breakfast was surprisingly plentiful... bagels, yogurt, tea, coffee, fruit, cereal, etc. definitely very filling. The room was modest, and comfortable, and not as small as I expected. The only thing I really didn't like was the shower- the head was not moveable, and it literally flooded the whole bathroom before I even noticed. So other than that, all in all a decent hotel, just a bit overpriced for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fussypot13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Elan Hotel in Los Angeles, this was in a fantastic location, we could walk to a shopping centre near by and had a great choice or restaurants, I initially thought it might be a bit noisy as our room was right on the road, however, it was surprisingly very quiet. The staff were very friendly and accommodated our needs. They have a happy hour of wine and cheese, which was an added bonus. The area for breakfast and happy hour is small and does get crowded, at times it was difficult to find a spare table, which was a bit frustrating. The rooms where clean and comfortable. All in all a great hotel, location for us was the best thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Foodnwinentravel
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a good location. Rooms are fairly big and well set-up. Valet parking works a treat! Only drawback is the lack of seating during breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff, Conveniently Located..”
Reviews.Author: rtravelsaround
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay at the Elan for 2 nights and came away happy with the experience. The hotel is located close to shopping, cafes and restaurants. What's more, it's also on the hop on-hop off bus route (which is a good way to see the city if you're there for a day). But the best part about the hotel was the front desk staff- they were really patient and helpful (thanks William and Michael!). We didn't get a chance to try the included b'fast (but it looked good), but were really kicked about the wine n' cheese in the evenings! As far as the room goes, it was comfortable enough even if a bit on the small side. Though very clean, I wish the room were more modern/chic instead of your regular hotel room, esp for the price paid. But hey, I guess the location, service etc. made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Liz T
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay was had at the Elan Hotel. The location is perfect as it is close to great shopping, great eateries, and the Hop-on Hop-off bus which takes you to Hollywood, Venice Beach etc. Shopping precincts within walking distance include the Beverly Center, Third Ave, The Grove and Farmers Market. We loved the nearby Toast cafe and Jan's Diner across the road! Our room was most comfortable and clean and the lounge area on the ground floor was wonderful for breakfast and 'happy hour' in the evenings ( what a great inclusion! ) and for simply just relaxing. Mostly, the entire staff go out of their way to make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible, nothing was too much trouble. Thank you Joel, William and Michael! I will definitely stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifc location - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: NvillePublicist
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Elan, and it won't be my last. The location absolutely can't be beat, and staff was courteous and efficient. The room size was fine for the price, and it was clean and up-to-date. And loved the "happy hour" that the hotel offered - I was able to take advantage of a nice glass of wine (over work, in fact!) while I was there...

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Claire154943
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Elan Hotel and I will definitely book here again the next time I am in LA. The location is perfect for any sort of trip. The staff is amazing; very accommodating. A special thank you to Michael who made our experience at the hotel even better. The breakfast in the morning is wonderful with plenty of choice. The wine and cheese in the evening is a nice touch. The rooms are clean and the room we had was spacious for two. My only complaint was hearing the people in the next room but that was probably due to the fact we had an adjoining room (I don't recommend that).

Reviews.Title: “A Very Satisfied Customer!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: This is an excerpt of the letter that I wrote to the hotel manager. "I would like to take a minute to thank you and your staff for your superior service and care. My wife stayed at your hotel for 2 ½ weeks while she underwent treatment at Cedars-Sinai. During this time your front desk staff’s attentiveness, friendliness and general humanity was refreshing. The parking valet who would run to hold the door open for my wife and the housekeeping staff that was quick, thorough and pleasant. Your staff is first rate, and I commend all of them for their service."

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: m1mars
Reviews.Content: The Elan is a nice hotel at the edge of Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. The Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was a little small and faced a inner courtyard with no view but with little to no street noise. The room had great access to the hotels free wi-fi but I had no service to my carrier ATT Room was 108. The breakfast was ok and the evenings wine and cheese was nice. The Beverly Center Mall is across the street but I would recommend The Grove or The Century City shopping center for shopping and dining. I would also like to recommend a diner called Swingers about a mile east of the hotel. The food is great and a place to eat after taking in the nightlife as they dont close till 4

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a big city!”
Reviews.Author: hols2go55
Reviews.Content: We found the Elan through Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The service was amazing; welcoming and helpful in all regards. The rooms are spacious and clean and very comfortable. We didn't get breakfast in most hotels so the breakfast here was a real treat. A great selection of cereals,fruit, yoghurt, toasts and muffins etc and always plenty. Even take away coffee cups so you can start the day with a coffee in hand. Our last morning we left early but breakfast was there for us to grab on the way. Presented with a smile from a bright, cheery attendant, even though our eyes were barely open. Evening wine and nibblies was a real treat after a day out sightseeing. Extras like this make this a truly outstanding place to stay. Is also in an excellent location. Right across from Beverly Centre and a fantastic pharmacy on the corner that sells alcohol at amazingly cheap prices if you are into a quiet drink in your room at night!! Open top bus leaves from outside Beverly Centre which was convenient for us as we only had a few days to explore.The bus is another story though. Look into routes and connection times before you venture to travel this way! We had five weeks travelling in the USA and experienced a great range of accommodation and service. The Elan is truly remarkable in the service it offers its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, Convenient, Kind”
Reviews.Author: kanaq
Reviews.Content: Room was not very big but receptionists were very kind and helpful, inter-net access was quite nice, and free breakfast was good though that was continental breakfast. There was a local restaurant opposite this hotel was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - CONVENIENT - SERVICE - BREAKFAST!”
Reviews.Author: betti14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elan as a last minute Saturday night in LA (we came a day earlier than we had planned for a week trip). All the other hotels in the area were at least $100 more! We actually booked that morning - they had a couple rooms left. This is a great area - convenient to West Hollywood, La Cienega, and Beverly Center. We arrived at 8pm, and immediately after check in took a cheap cab to the Sunset Strip as it was my first trip to LA. On a nice night you could actually walk to the Strip, but it was cool and getting rainy (plus its an uphill walk). The room was ok. Our 1st floor room had a slider to the side walkway of the hotel - I didnt like being that close to people walking by, but I wasn't at the room very long, and I dont people generally walk out there anyway. As long as you are on a higher floor it wont be an issue. the bathroom was huge and the robes nice. The best part of this place besides location was the breakfast. Wow - I was expecting coffee and a banana when they said continental, but this was great. Selection of coffees, OJ, Lemon Water and some others. Boiled eggs, Bagels (with toaster nearby), jam, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, pastries and muffins. I think I am leaving out some stuff. Anyway, I was impressed this was included as part of the price of the room. This spread at a diner or coffee shop would have been at least $15pp if they had this selection. Unlimited made it even better! For some this may not be important but I was on a long flight to get here and had lots of things planned so it was nice to get a solid - quick breakfast without having to fork out more money. A few Newspapers were available for free as well! The breakfast area was really nice too - some tables, couch with coffee table and a couple flat screen tv's. Also a few computers were available for use. Overall seemed like a glamourous budget hotel, safe, clean, well situated and staff very motivated to help. No real amenities like a gym or pool but like i said, a great base and good service. We spent the next 3 nights at the Sofitel down the street which was REALLY nice, with pool, gym, spa, and on-site restaurant / nightclub, but you'll pay 20-30% more on any given night. We got a good deal due to it being the week of thanksgiving so it was worth it. If you like to shop, the Beverly Center and Nordstrom's Rack are right there. Melrose Ave is a few blocks north. Robertson St with all the new designers is a 15 min walk, and the Grove about 25 min walk the other way. I'm not big on buses or public transportation, but did take a bus down Melrose Ave one night home from Pink's Hot Dogs (to Melrose at LaCienega) for $1.50 each, because we were sick of paying 10x that for cabs to go just a mile or so down the street. Overall I would stay again, but if I were spending a lot of time at the hotel and got a good deal, I'd upgrade to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: sandraLondon_England
Reviews.Content: We have just had a second great stay at the Elan hotel - the staff were all very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to assist us. The hotel has recently been refurbished and is very good value, especially for the location. Internet is complimentary which is not found in all hotels, as well as a complimentary breakfast and evening cheese and wine reception. Along with other reviewers we highly recommend the Elan hotel and thanks to Joel, reception and all the staff for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Vine hours”
Reviews.Author: Emnuzt
Reviews.Content: Good location, very helpfull and friendly staff and free vine hours at afternoon. At our next trip to Los Angeles I will try to stay at the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelp1990
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of the Beverly Centre and the Grove. Bus services nearby. The service was fantastic and despite power going out the staff continued to treat us with perfect service. Would love an experience like this at all hotels

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that cares!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary K
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Élan Hotel, and after a few recent stays at some of the expensive, large hotels I was thrilled to stay at the Élan where you were always greeted on your return, the door opened and a friendly face. The breakfast in the lobby a great start to the day and just loved coming back to the hotel for wine and cheese at 5pm ( all complimentary). Really well located, 15 minute walk to the Farmers Market, next door to the Beverly Centre and plenty of places to eat. The Hop on and off bus goes from the Beverley Centre. Thanks to Joel the GM, William and all the staff for a memorable stay. The Élan was recommended to me by friends and would I certainly agree. Ps. Great beds and lovely bathrooms that are well stocked with toiletries that are now scarce in the large hotels!!!' Free WiFi huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: dieselbearholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan hotel for 3 nights in a deluxe room, we had arrived early and were offered an early check in for $50, which we went for with no hesitation after flying through the night and having had no sleep. The hotel is conveniently located near a department store, and is relatively close to Hollywood Boulevard etc. The decor in the hotel room was a little outdated, and we were in a room upstairs which overlooked a courtyard. The bed was not very comfortable and was only a double, but was ok for a short stay. The service was fantastic and staff were very helpful. The breakfast bar is nice and had more than enough to keep us going. There is also a 'happy hour' where the hotel puts on complementary wine and nibblies in the evening for an hour or so. This was a nice touch and we enjoyed having a couple of wines after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Experience at Elan, LA”
Reviews.Author: Roxymusic4
Reviews.Content: Six months after my initial visit to Cedars-Sinai, I returned for a week of follow-up tests and stayed again at Elan. I was welcomed by very professional, friendly and caring staff. My room was lovely: very clean, king size bed, flat screen TV, free WiFi computer access, room safe, mini bar, beautiful patio view, etc. During my stay I frequented the daily continental breakfast bar and the nightly wine and cheese reception. I had so much fun meeting guests from far and near also attending these activities. After receiving medical "good news", I celebrated that evening during the wine and cheese reception with guests who were now new friends. This time I explored the Beverly Center, Melrose Ave and other interesting areas. If I needed a cab and knew ahead of time, the staff had one waiting for me. The area is delightful and safe for walks and I took many. There are also a variety of eateries nearby. I plan to return in a year and have already made reservations to stay at Elan. It is a lovely boutique hotel and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mtnguy1
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the Elan Hotel for a recent business trip. The front desk staff were very nice and unlike many hotels the valet parking was fast and efficient. The continental breakfast that is included was adequate. The wine and cheese from 5-7pm wasn't great wine but I must say a nice touch. My only negative comment about the hotel is what seemed to be very thin walls. I could hear the people talking in the room next to me (thankfully they were not up late) and once people started moving in the halls you can definitely hear that. I'd recommend the hotel as great value with a central location. The rooms were really clean and well equipped with what looked like new furnishings. Overall a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Elan!”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: I was drawn to this hotel because of it's location, and I was very satisfied. It's located in a very SAFE area - a major factor when considering where to stay in LA. It's a 3 minute walk from the beverly cente, and you also have a 24 hour pharmacy across the road. As for the hotel itself. . .it's not glamorous. . .but it does the job. Check-in was fast, and our room was clean and modern - although a little small. I was also pretty happy with the in room cable tv package - it even had a channel that showed all european football (soccer) matches! Also the continental breakfast was decent. It's served in the lobby cafe area where you can find a free to use internet station. Regarding value, we paid approximately $150 per night - that's great value for Beverly Hills. However a downer is cost of the valet parking service - $15 daily!

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff, luxurious and added extras”
Reviews.Author: Terri B
Reviews.Content: This hotel really exceeded all our expectations. The staff were very engaging and helpful, the wine reception every evening was great and allowed us to meet other lovely people, and the complimentary continental breakfast was an added bonus. Our room was spotlessly clean and very luxurious, with a lot of little extras that make all the difference: a 'real' hairdryer (not the ones attached to the wall that most hotels have). The internet worked first time and was free, there were not one but two large screen TVs, the toiletries were very good quality and the mini bar was very reasonably priced. This hotel is within walking distance of the Beverly Centre, The Grove, CBS Studios and Cedars Sinai. I would definitely stay there again, especially as they gave us a great rate. We really felt like we were getting a 6.5 star experience for a 4 star price. What more could you want? Terri and Steve from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Still the best boutique hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: Been staying at Elan since it opened and it is as nice today as it was day 1. Great location near Bev Center, comfortable beds, high thread count sheets, evening wine and cheese reception - nice hotel after all these years.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW1111
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews about the Elan, I have to say we were disappointed in our stay. When we checked into our room, the bedspreads were taped up and 2 floor fans were blowing on to the beds. I called down to the desk and they said maintenence was going on in that room. He said it would take 20 minutes for a room to be made up. We waited 45 minutes before the new room was ready. The hotel is anything but "boutique". The room was small, sparsely furnished, and had no real charm. The bathroom was outdated, and it appeared to be a motel that had been badly converted. While the staff was accommodating, the hotel itself was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Finnaus75
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely recommend staying here as the location is fantastic and the staff are incredibly helpful, friendly and ready with recommendations. Only thing that surprised me was that the room was pretty small (but that may be typical in LA?) and the way ours was located, we could see through the next room's sliding doors if curtains weren't drawn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vansitar
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Elan in the last two years. Each time the staff have been excellent and very helpful. From the two Michaels on the front desk, Efrem (hope that's spelt right) out the front to the housekeeping staff nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast and the wine and cheese are a nice touch and very much appreciated. Other little touches like the ice water and lemonade in the foyer really make a difference. The location is hard to beat. The Beverley Centre is a minutes walk away, a CVS store even closer, a 10-15 min walk to the Grove and Farmers Market, many resturants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katebk76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights en route to my sisters wedding. I was very impressed by the rooms, decor, breakfast and evening wine reception. What topped it off was the wonderful customer service and friendly attitude of all the staff I encountered. The neighborhood felt safe and I felt very comfortable wondering around by myself - even at night. I would highly recommend this hotel and intend to stay there whenever I am passing through LA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: winniecody
Reviews.Content: Found Elan Hotel on tripadvisor.com. We went to LA to attend the Dancing with the Stars show on Monday, Nov 7th. We got to hotel late about 10 pm, but they were waiting for us and very accommodating. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. We had two rooms with two queen beds each. Very comfortable beds and pillows; quiet rooms; large bathrooms with robes and plenty of towels. Enjoyed the continental breakfast, coffee was not as good as we would like, but that is only negative criticism. About 1.2 mile from The Grove and couple blocks from Beverly Center. Would stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: GlenLivet
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, small hotel. I would classify it as a “boutique” hotel. It was reasonably priced for the area. The valet parking cost an additional $24/day and there does not seem to be any other option. If you fly into LA and don’t have a car, this is not an issue. The rooms are smallish, almost European in size, at least the one we had (221). However. The rooms are well appointed with all the standard amenities including in-room safe, hair dryer, refrigerator, mini-bar, and robes. There is free wireless internet in the room, although it was a bit slow & spotty at times. There is also an Ethernet connection. The complimentary breakfast was very good with excellent pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juice and coffee. There was also complimentary wine and cheese served each afternoon at 5-7PM. The wine was pretty good (Penfolds) and the snacks welcome. The area near the where the breakfast and wine was pretty small, so if there were a lot of guest, you might have trouble finding a place to sit. You could take it back to your room. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and, quite attentive. The biggest advantage of the Elan is its’ location. It is located on Beverly Blvd less then a block from a large shopping complex. There is a CVS Store less then a block away and there are several restaurants within easy walking distance. It is about a 20-minute walk to Rodeo Drive and about a 10 minute drive to Sunset Strip and Hollywood Blvd. It is about 5 minutes to get on Interstate 10 and it took about 20 minutes to get to LAX. I absolutely recommend the Elan Hotel. When we go back to LA, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing”
Reviews.Author: platypusgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Elan at the end of a 6-week trip including 4 weeks in the US. I could not recommend it more highly. The staff and service were excellent, very friendly and responsive, especially William, but they were all good. Our room was clean, nice and comfortable with everything you want and a small balcony looking over the street, and there was no noise problem from the street. I especially liked all the little touches and attention to detail that contributed to our comfort and enjoyment - for example, the weather forecast card left on the bed each night, the magnifying makeup mirror in the bathroom, and the cooperation with our need for a late checkout. We loved the complementary wine and cheese from 5-7 pm, very relaxing after a day's explorations. A good breakfast was included, and they even had vegemite (a nice touch for us Aussies). As people have said, LA can be difficult without a car. We generally use public transport everywhere but didn't try in LA. On our first day we took the Urban Adventures LA Getaway tour - see http://www.urbanadventures.com/los_angeles_tour_LA_Getaway , which was excellent. We had to get a taxi to the starting point (I think it cost about $20) but they dropped us off at the hotel afterwards. On the second day we shopped at the Beverly Centre which is very close by, and then went by taxi to the Getty Centre, which was a hefty fare (I think about $50 each way including tip) but there is no entrance fee and it was really worth it. Both nights we ate at the Mandarette Chinese restaurant on the other side of Beverly Boulevard - normally I like to try different places but it was so good and so convenient. Thank you Joel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: goony51
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located, with friendly staff. Reasonable breakfast and fast internet. Not sure what more you could ask for. Would highly recommend to friends and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: facls
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife traveled the West Coast this October and the Elan Hotel was, by far, our favorite hotel from the trip. Service was exceptional. We were very well received by the staff, who was friendly and extremely helpful with tips for LA. We had a parking package and the service was quick, and the valets also gave us great tips for nearby dining. They were all very friendly and one of them was also from Brazil. The room was very good, nice space, very clean, great bathroom. Our room faced Beverly Boulevard but we didn't have any issues with street noise. Wi-fi was included and worked well, and they also have two desktops in the lobby for internet access. We had breakfast on the last day there, it was quite good for a complimentary breakfast, with good variety of breads and muffins. The wine and cheese reception was also a nice touch. You do need a car to get around in LA easily, but the location of the Elan is great, with no more than 20-30 minute drives to major attractions like Hollywood, Warner Studios, Santa Monica, Downtown and Beverly Hills. We didn't have any issues with the infamous LA traffic, but being from São Paulo, one of the worst cities in the world to drive a car, probably influenced my opinion. There are also good places that you can walk to, the Beverly Center and a 24 hours CVS are a block away, a great deli called Jerry's is a 10 minute walk, as is a nice bakery called Joan's on 3rd. Next time we are in LA (and we'll definitely be back, we loved the city and three days was not enough), we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Good”
Reviews.Author: DanWarwick
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in LA at the Elan hotel. The hotel generally was great. The positives are: the location was good, the staff were super friendly and helpful, the cheese and wine reception was nice and the breakfast was fab...In the US I find that the breakfasts are generally a coffee, a piece of fruit and a muffin, but at the Elan it was bagels, pastries, cereals, eggs, cheese, yoghurts, tea, coffee and juices. A really nice surprise! There was only a couple of negatives and that was the weird smell in the hotel...it kinda smells like bathrooms (clean ones, but bathrooms none the less) and nappies (or diapers).... We smelt it as soon as we entered the reception and it's something that stayed with us throughout the hotel. The other one was the pillows, they are quite bobberly and hard. Aside from that, I would stay here again because everything else was good and the price for the location is ace.

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Soleil060
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor. The reviews was exactly what I found when I was staying at the Elan. Very helpful frontdesk. I am a senior lady alone my room was small but quiet and impeccable and I fell secure in the neighbourghood.

Reviews.Title: “Great staying”
Reviews.Author: Cricca72
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel searching over the web and its web site made me a good impression, but I finally got here it exceeded my expectations! Very friendly and helpful staff Wi-fi and computer available in the lobby Good breakfast and a fantastic wine & cheese in the late afternoon ... A perfect way to begin and end the day Confy and nice rooms Also the location is great, we were in LA for leisure and we managed to reach all places thru either public transportation and city sightseeing (both are just next door). I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: BiznPleasure
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. West Hollywood is cosmopolitan, has great eateries - we walked to all the places we ate dinner for our 3 night stay, and for shoppers there is the Beverly Centre, Nordstrum Rack, Ross for Dress, Marshalls as well as others all across the road. The staff are good-humoured, welcoming, helfpful and unobtrusive? Wegot to breakfast twice and it is adequate and a bit of a relief in not being over-indulgent. The wine and cheese 2 hours is not an exposure to vintage but a very nice, relaxing way to en the day and start the evening. This was our second stay and we have no reason to not come back for a third.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: stephenp65
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to all the staff at the Elan. My wife, daughter and I just got back from the US where we stayed at 6 differeent hotels. The service at the Elan was without a doubt the best of all. From the moment Michael greeted us at the front desk, exhausted after the long flight from Sydney, we knew we had choosen the best place to stay in LA. A great central location with friendly valet parking; very tasty breakfast and free wine and cheese to kick off the evening. The rooms were appointed with little luxuries that were a pleasant surprise for such a well price accomodation. We must give a special thank you to Omar who went above and beyond. After we left the hotel my daughter realised (with horror) that she had left behind her beloved childhood cuddly toys and blanket that she had slept with since she was a baby. Omar organised them to be forwarded to New York where she received them safely. This exemplified the dedication to service that sets the Elan far above the rest.We will certainly be recommending you to all we know and we are already planning a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: LerMar
Reviews.Content: We visited LA last summer and stayed twice in Elan hotel at first for 2 nights and then for 4 more nights. The hotel was really a surprise for us, as we were dissapointed while searching for hotels in the area which were either very expensive or just awful. The Elan was very clean, the rooms (both) were huge. They had cable TV and free wi-fi. Great breakfast, you didn't need anything else, wine and cheese in the evening. Staff was awesome and very helpful. Right next to the Bev. Center and to a 24/7 CVS store. I really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeandallen
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights there on vacation. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Using the parking garage is compulsory $24 + tax a night valet parking, which seemed a bit steep, but I don't know how safe the behind the hotel off-street would be. (You can't overnight park in the nearby Beverly Centre). Room very clean and a good size. Complimentary breakfast really good - lots of fruit and healthy choices. Cheese and wine in the evenings a nice touch. Excellent free wi-fi. Very central - 20 minutes from LAX, a block from the Beverly Centre, a few blocks from the Farmers Market/The Grove, and 20 minutes to the beach (outside the rush hour). Good eateries within walking distance. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can not say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parvaz
Reviews.Content: Super super nice staff. Especially Michael Kim. Beyond helpful. Excellent breakfast, and happy hours (free if you are a hotel guest). NIce clean rooms and huge bathrooms. After 5 days, it felt like home. You can not find a better location. This was my 2nd time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Price is kinda Steep”
Reviews.Author: wayne900
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night before i fly back home. Not sure if my expectation is too high after reading all the comments in tripadvisor. Well here are my comments. - The staffs are friendly and very helpful. When I checked in at 6pm, they invited us to join the free wine and cheese session. Pass us a map of the restaurant nearby and advise us which are the places that is within walking distance - My room is on the 1st floor just beside the dining area. Room is clean but not that big. When i'm in the toilet bathing, i actually can hear another couple talking in their room. - Location is good. walked to beverly center but as i arrive quite late, can't really explore the place much. - Breakfast is normal. Maybe i expect better food, i think i can have better breakfast else well. For the price they are charging, i think it is a bit steep. Next time if i'm in LA, i'm not sure if i will stay at this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, central to all.”
Reviews.Author: annifree
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the hotel service was excellent. They happily accommodated our request for a quiet room (in back of hotel on 2nd floor). The staff always seemed genuinely friendly and happy to see you. The complimentary breakfast was great and always fresh: cereals, eggs, bagels, muffins, tea, coffee, juice, yogurt, fruit etc., and they topped that with complimentary cheese and wine in the evenings. Though the king room we had was on the small side, the hotel itself was updated and clean. The location in West Hollywood was central to everything we needed to be at. To top it off we found a great little Mediterranean fine dining restaurant called Mezze, located at 401 N. La Cienega Blvd., just 4 blocks walking distance from the hotel (find it by strolling through the pleasant middle class, wooded neighborhood just behind the hotel). We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KathyB2557
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellence in customer service. The hotel is in a great location and is very comfortable. This boutique hotel offers everything a major hotel would offer including chocolates on the pillow at night, a summary of the weather for the next day, These are just a couple of little things that help make the stay even more enjoyable. The breakfasts were more than adequate and the wine and cheese late in the afternoon was very nice to come home to after a full day sightseeing. There is obviously a high level of thought and care that goes into choosing the wines and cheeses for the guests. My husband and I celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary on this trip and the Manager arranged for a beautiful flower arrangement for us. Very caring and thank you so much to the Elan Hotel.....Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: alan w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights from September 20 in a junior suite and stay was very good.Staff are all first class and never had a problem.Breakfast was fantastic with really good choices and wine and cheese,when we used it was good. Room was first class,clean tidy and everything we needed.Very quite with an inside room.Just a bit cramped for room for 3 people but we managed. Best part was the local area,Beverly center,Grove and a Jan's across the road for eats and drinks.Always good food close by. I definitely would stay here again but like i said if there was just 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccallama
Reviews.Content: After a good few hours on the internet searching for a hotel in LA which gave the perfect balance of being good value for money, in a good, and safe location, and also offered a little luxury, we were about ready to give up. Then we came across the Elan hotel. The location (just a couple of blocks from the Beverly Center, a stop on the hop-on, hop off bus service line, and walkable to the Grove and the Farmers market) was absolutely perfect, and compared to other hotels we saw in the area, the price was right. The staff on reception, including Joel, were exceptionally friendly when we checked in, and more than happy to help out given we only had a limited time in LA. The rooms were immaculate, and full of lovely touches such as robes/slippers/stationery etc. The beds were super comfortable, and despite the jet lag we slept really well. Breakfast in the morning was great, with a good selection of juices, bagels, fruits, cereals and muffins. My only small issue was that the valet parking was quite steep, at $26, but I guess this is LA! I would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in LA, who wants to be near to Beverly Hills and West Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Élan!”
Reviews.Author: ShopBread
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in perfect west side location as a jumping off point to all that Los Angeles has to offer. We enjoyed the complimentary morning breakfast choices as well as wine and cheese hour in the afternoon. Our suite was lovely......very comfortable beds, contemporary, cozy and very clean. Never a wait to get our car from valet parking and all staff couldn't have been nicer. Would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti G
Reviews.Content: The staff were super helpful, friendly, knowledgeable welcoming. From the front desk to the housekeepers, everyone was lovely. Our room was in perfect condition, a great size and we had a balcony and a view of the Hollywood hills, which was fab. The location was fantastic - across the road from the Beverly Center, a mile away from The Farmer's Market/The Grove and not far from Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills. When looking for somewhere to stay in LA, we were put off reviews of most neighbourhoods. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a safe part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personal service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: email_iandsmith
Reviews.Content: What this small hotel lacks in size it more than makes up with in service. It is so nice to have friendly and helpful staff who remember your name and go out of the way to provide you with helpful advice. Michael O was particularly helpful and a lovely guy. Our room was larger than I expected after reading some of the previous reviews. It was also clean and well stocked with all amenities. The location was great as it was only 5 mins walk to the "hop on - hop off" tour bus and also close to bus stops. Well done to the manager for running a great little hotel and also hiring great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: vlelh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good for what it was. My husband and I found the hotel on Expedia and booked two nights over the weekend at about $210 a night. We thought the price was pretty good for the location of the hotel, and for a Friday and Saturday night. It's in a decent neighborhood within walking distance to the Beverly Center and other restaurants. There is no self-parking which is not uncommon for a small boutique hotel, so you can either park in a metered spot or valet. Valet was about $26 a day after taxes, and we thought it was worth it. The valet staff was always on top of it. We got our car in and out of valet several times and each time we would just call ahead of time to have our car ready and our car was always right outside within 15 min. Our room at the hotel was not bad. It was on the first floor and opened into a small courtyard facing other rooms. That said, it was not very private if you opened the curtains so we kept the curtains closed most of the time which made the room dark. And the fact that all the lights in the room were fluorescent lighting didn't help, but overall, that didn't bother us. The room was really tiny and the bathroom was pretty small too with virtually no counter space so I had to put all of our toiletries and my makeup on the desk outside of the bathroom. But again, this is not uncommon for a small boutique hotel and it wasn't that big of a deal to us. The light in our bathroom made an annoying buzzing sound and the bed was a little firm and stiff for my tastes though my husband thought the bed was comfortable. The walls were not sound proof as we could hear noises all around us including doors shutting and people talking constantly. When we first checked in, we smelled pot in the hallway and the smell seeped into our room because there isn't a great seal around the door which I'm sure is also what contributed to how easily we could hear outside noises. I called the front desk about the pot smell and they took care of it right away. Overall though, the room was clean and updated pretty well for, what I could tell was, a really old building. It was also nice that they provided complimentary wifi even though it was kind of slow, breakfast in the mornings, and wine and cheese receptions in the evenings. The staff was also really friendly and courteous. All in all, the hotel and the location were pretty good for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay . Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: monaco2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three nights. The location is great, near shopping malls and easy access to freeways and sightseeing places. It is a friendly hotel with good breakfast and nice comfortable rooms. The staff is very helpful and not only give you tips but also look for addresses and even call places if it is necessary. They are really great. The only cons: no swimming pool (it was really hot) and parking is U$ 24 with valet. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliO_11
Reviews.Content: At first i was disappointed when i first arrived at the hotel. For sone reason i was expecting a massive hotel but it was right the opposite. I didn't know what to expect but just after we checked in and went to our room i started enjoying the little cozy place. Pros: - Amazing service - really friendly and helpful staff. - Valet parking included if you go for the room and parking package ( i highly recommend to go for that if u have a car as there is no parking around). - quite a few good restaurants in the area (walking distance). - 10 min drive to Hollywood Blvd. - 2 min walk to Macy's. In front of Macy's is the bus stop for the Tour Bus Company (if you have tickets you can use them to get anywhere in LA). - about 1 hr easy drive to Santa Monica (thru town) and even less if you take the highway. - Complimentary Wine and cheese every evening for 2 hrs - in the lobby. Cons: I can't think of any. We enjoyed our stay at ELAN.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice; great "boutique" hotel, very good location, even without car”
Reviews.Author: Kristiina N
Reviews.Content: Thank you for General Manager Joel Majors and his very helpful staff! We are two ladies( Sweden and Finland) and we travel a lot. Hotel Elan is one of the best hotels, in big cities, we have visited. We try to find good middle price hotels and Elan hotel was best choice of all. Spirit of hotel is unique elegant and sophisticated. Small is beautiful!! We spent in Elan hotel 4 nights. Our room was beauty, absolutely clean. Service in front desk was excellent. Breakfast was good and as surprise from 5-7 pm there was also wine+cheese+fruit buffee. Because we didn't have car location was also great to us: we could walk in many places, shopping center was behind corner as also bus stop to sightseeing bus. We had feeling that everybody in Elan Hotel really cares us. WE WARMLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: grandmaairplane
Reviews.Content: I went to Los Angeles on business and stayed over for one night. The only good thing was the location of the hotel. The room was small and very outdated. There was never anyone on duty outside for valet parking..ended up parking at a meter more than once. When I think boutique, I actually think charming and very nice. Neither....will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: BlueBadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the recommendation of a colleague and I was so pleased with the results. This hotel is close to the Beverly Center for great shopping and centrally located so that you can use Public Transportation in L.A. I was able to travel easily to Beverly Hills, Westwood, and the airport. It's a small boutique hotel but was very comfortable and included complimentary breakfast and a wine and cheese hour. A lot of the guests were international and very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the contintenal breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Julia T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found the hotel to be great value for money. While the rooms were a little small, the great service and the delicious continental breakfast made our stay hassle free. The hotel is located in a nice area and is fairly central. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Took Everyones Advice”
Reviews.Author: eric f
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend is somewhat of a hotel snob, so Ive learned to let her pick the hotel so she can't blame me if it isn't perfect. She had absolutely nothing negative to stay and really enjoyed it. We went to W Hollywood just for 1 night for a concert. We usually go to the beach, not W Hollywood, so we had no idea where to stay. After some research, she came across the Elan Hotel. She loved the great reviews and was especially impressed with the managers feedback to all the reviews, both good and marginal. Upon arrival, the front clerks were very friendly and helpful. The property, while not new, was very well taken care of and clean. I really can't think of anything more to say as we got in around 8 pm and left by 11 am, so didnt get a chance enjoy the cocktail hour. All I know is that I would not hesitate to stay here again. If I was absolutely pressed for a negative, I would say the minibar fridge needs to be set colder...but seriously, that is just nit-picking and if someone really wanted to complain about that, Id tell them to get a life... About my rankings...I do not give a 5 as though it is a five star hotel...I give a relative rating based on the price point of what I am reviewing. For the money in this area, I have a feeling this place would be hard to beat...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Cornelia A
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with outstanding employees and excellent service. Stayed with friends who were visiting from out of town and we all loved it. It's quaint, small, not overcrowded with a nice "boutique" feeling. Enjoyed evening wine reception and the selection of wine offered to the guests. The continental breakfast was another nice feature with an abundant selection of food. My friends also enjoyed it tremendously and we will stay again the next time they visit. Want to give a "shout out" to the entire staff, but especially to GM Joel Majors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique; good location”
Reviews.Author: slate12
Reviews.Content: Elan is located close to businesses, film & TV studios and a large shopping mall, on good bus lines (for cheaper transportation!). Feels like a safe neighborhood. The rooms are small but very clean and well-appointed. Got a discount for multiple-day reservations online and the price includes a daily continental breakfast and evening happy hour. Safe, nice and a good deal for LA!

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely and friendly, very charming”
Reviews.Author: ozjasmine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in Oct. 2010. It's a small hotel, but the location is great. The room is on the small side, but very clean and functional. Staff were friendly and helpful. We especially loved the 5pm tp 7pm cheese and wine time. It was wonderful to see all the Australian wine provided. The free breakfast was lovely as well. They also provide the free internet in the lobby area which was very convenient. We really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home on LA”
Reviews.Author: smdubowsky
Reviews.Content: Besides the great value, the breakfast and the wine and cheese; it's the friendly service that sets this small gem of a hotel apart. The location is great especially if you know to take LaCienega right to LAX. We come from the east coast several times a year to visit our son, and this is THE place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: jinxkingston
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Elan. The room was nice, the location was ideal for us. Highlight was the wine/cheese late in the afternoon and a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Why Are We Being Punished?”
Reviews.Author: Harris_of_Hollywood
Reviews.Content: I would like to preference this by saying that we most likely had the WORST room in the entire hotel. With that being said, even your WORST room in a hotel should be better than staying at home... or at least, a Holiday Inn. But no, this had more than just a jail cell with a horrible color scheme. When we arrived late, there was no one to park our car at the valet station. and when we went in, it took forever to finally get someone to help with the car. So, my friend is in the car at the curb waiting for the valet to come get the keys and park the car, and what does teh valet guy do? Stand there about 10 feet from teh car and stare into space?! I watched him through the hotel lobby doors, thining that my friend was on teh ohone or something... 10 minutes later I come outside and peer into the car and my friend is like "where is the valet guy?!" I turn to the valet and ask him what he's waiting for? His reposne "oh, he was still in the car." SO GO UP AND OPEN THE DOOR AND PARK THE CAR?! I don't understand just standing there 10 feet from the car? We should have left then. When we checked into the room, it was about the size of a closet. bathroom, jail cell, what have you. Tiny room with the curtains jutting out into the room, taking away more space. A huge UGLY lamp that descended from the ceiling, and bulky dresser, leaving ZERO room to manuver. The bed was not comfortable, and it was so bad all we could do was laugh. We called to switch rooms, but they were sold out. The next morning, I went to go get breakfast, which was complimentary and pathetic. We did not enjoy our stay and will never return - #SiberianGulag

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bizwarrier
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to get away to celebrate a birthday for a few days. We needed to stay somewhere close in to the west L.A./Hollywood/Santa Monica area to make excursions to good food, sightseeing and a bit of shopping.
