We've traveled a great deal over the years and are particular when it comes to where we'll stay: Clean, safe and quiet are at the top of our list, followed by friendly staff, good location and reasonable cost. We researched hotels in the L.A. area and were impressed by the Elan. It ranked #2 out of more than 250 hotels rated, so we began by emailing them for availability and to see if they could meet our expectations. Our experience was nothing short of exceptional. Joel, the manager, responded quickly to our requests, providing us with detailed information about the property, room availability, proximity to restaurants and shopping and in general, putting our minds at ease with our decision to stay there, sight unseen. The positive experience begins at the front desk of this centrally located, boutique hotel. The staff is professional and friendly; our request for a quiet room was accommodated; our check in was smooth and the room was comfortable and nicely appointed, from the magnifying mirror in the bathroom to the artwork on the walls: it's the small touches that set this hotel apart. Sure, there's no pool or overpriced coffee shop attached, but the appointments to one's comfort have been carefully thought out. We discovered the Elan was a short walk away from a major shopping center in one direction, about a mile from the Grove and the Farmer's Market the other way. Valet parking eases the burden of driving, and we never had to wait for our car. They even provide a list of radio stations on a card left in the car. We can't thank the staff enough for making our little getaway such an ideal experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Cedars-Sinai patients and family. And vacation travel!”
Reviews.Author: Battmother
Reviews.Content: I don't know why we have not chosen the Elan before but it will now be our "go to" hotel for LA. I have been taking my daughter to Cedars-Sinai for 8 years for medical care and usually needed a room for a couple of nights during our visit. I would always use bidding on Priceline to get a bargain. Those bargains are no longer as good as they have been. I called the hotel directly for a Cedars-Sinai rate and it was extremely competitive, in fact lower than the Priceline bid and other area hotels in the same star category. The Elan provides outstanding customer service. It is apparent that is the priority. Because of the time we needed for my daughter's procedure, I requested an early check-in and late check-out and they were very accommodating. The room was spotless and comfy. Every staff member from reservations, valet, front desk to housekeeping performed at the highest expectation. The location is perfect for anyone who goes to Cedars-Sinai as a patient, visitor or for a meeting. You can walk to avoid additional parking fees. There are more restaurants than you can count that are walking distance. CVS is right down the street for pharmacy needs and Jerry's Deli is just a few blocks further for chicken soup! There is no need to spend more money on the Sofitel which is across from Cedars-Sinai(I have many other times). The Elan is much more reasonable and delivers better customer service in a beautiful room, less hassle and a comfy caring atmosphere. Sometimes the smaller boutique hotels I have stayed at in the same area were a great disappointment and I avoided that type of hotel but the Elan is absolutely the gold standard of smaller boutique type hotels. Of course the complimentary continental breakfast and wine reception were a bonus not seen many places in the US and had the quality of a fine European hotel. Easy access to the internet via wifi or the 2 lobby computers are perfect. I also highly recommend the Elan for LA travel and vacation. The location is central to so many areas. I think my Priceline bidding days are over for the LA area and will now be going right to the Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkfincher
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay two nights at the Elan, but due to a water main break the day of my arrival, the hotel had to close for a day. They booked me for one night at another hotel, which they paid for. Then when I did return to the Elan the next day, they paid for that night as well. The hotel was very comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I particularly appreciated their generosity in comping for what was really not much of an inconvenience at all. I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: NHYanks
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here passing through So Cal and found the staff so helpful and friendly! Our room was comfortable, very clean and quiet. Parking is valet only but they are always available to get your car for you. Hotel is walking distance to 3rd street shopping, Farmers Market and Cedars Sinai Hospital. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean with comps”
Reviews.Author: Squigleys
Reviews.Content: The staff at The Elan are very friendly and will go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and offer great advice to help you around the city. Unlike many city hotels these days the Elan offer cont. breakfast which inc. Wolfgang Puck coffee, juices, pastries, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, cereals etc so quite adequate and very tasty. They also offer free cheese and wine in the late afternoon, nothing special on the wine side but a nice start to the early evening and chance to chat to the other guests. The rooms are fairly small but clean and cosy...also the odd bedtime choccy on the pillow. All in all this hotel provides some nice extra touches and very good service. Unfortunately on a personal level we were woken on two mornings when maintenance work in the hotel which we not previously notified about, commenced. It is a tasteful and comfortable small hotel, convenient for the airport and some local amenities, but not much nightlife. The car parking is rather expensive at $24 per night (per 24 hrs regardless how often you use your car) plus tax (which the travel agents don't mention) so it's a bit like giving your car accommodation too! I did know beforehand but having looked at prices around the city, it is a bit steep...probably pays for all the little comps! To sum up, really lovely hotel and cleaning staff with attention to service but would probably look to find a hotel somewhere in a better location in future with the ability to walk/public transport to places of interest/good restaurants/bars instead of using the car in this very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “warm, inviting and scrumptous!!”
Reviews.Author: room4me
Reviews.Content: long over due review. my adult daughter and i stayed at The Elan in March 2011. we had an absolutely perfect time there. the staff was extremely friendly and professional...really 1st class- from greeting us at check-in, wishing us a good day as we set out to explore,and welcoming us back -it was just like coming home. the breakfast and evening wine and cheese were so lovely. our room was clean and comfy and being a last minute trip we had to book a one bed king room which was fine for us. i highly recommend The Elan as a wonderfully located and AAA+ place for adults to call home while visiting LA . cabs are easy to hail and not expensive but we did a lot of walking to places such as CBS studios (the price is right) and the Grove ( for dining and shopping) . don't wait! don't hesitate! GO! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Tressa90
Reviews.Content: A really well situated, friendly boutique hotel in West Hollywood. Staff was very helpful and accomodating, the rooms are small-ish but very nice, conveniently located near a great strip of restaurants and shopping on West 3rd St. Breakfast was nothing special but there is the Kings Road cafe two blocks over on Beverly St. that does decent coffee and has a great breakfast selection. Very convenient for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay again”
Reviews.Author: Julie550
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May this year on a trip with my mother. The hotel is well located and clean, The room was a nice size and we were really impressed with the chocolates on the pillows each night and also a card detailing what the weather would be like the next day. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bell man (I can't remember his name ) is a great asset to this hotel. The selection for breakfast was great and the wine and cheese of an afternoon was very relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. The Beverly Centre is just a short walk and the Hop On Hop Off double decker bus stop is just outside the Beverly Centre. There is also a diner across the road if you want a cheap meal. I have recommended to other people who are thinking about visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot excellent service”
Reviews.Author: thatkiwijoker
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Elan, the team always make you welcome and their tips on where to eat are spot on, the hotel in clean welcoming and convenient to everything will use again

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stanneken
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed rooms, if somewhat small. Location, right next to cedars-sinai and a short drive from the grove, sunset blvd, rodeo dr, etc, etc, etc is amazing for tourists visiting LA. LAX is also only 20 minutes away. Staff were friendly and informative. Breakfast was simple but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly overrated”
Reviews.Author: Specialaw
Reviews.Content: The recent Trip Advisor rating of this hotel as #1 in Los Angeles and #2 in the nation was beguiling enough to entice us to book a room. The reality is that this is a pleasant enough hotel (though with a motel-ish feel), but simply doesn't deserve a #1 or 2 rating on anyone's list of best hotels in any market of significant size. Staff are friendly, courteous, and helpful. The room we were given was clean and functional. Complimentary breakfast and wine and cheese evenings are nice. This would be a good choice for location or (possibly) price, but for a traveler seeking the comfort and convenience of the kind of luxury hotel that is implied by a high user rating, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: S_A_L_W_80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights and it was incredibly clean which is very important for me. The breakfast selection is generous with great variety. The hotel is located just opposite Beverly Centre and nice walk to Rodeo drive so if you are a shopaholic and don't want to hire a car, this location is fantastic. They had free wi-fi throughout hotel as well. I felt they did everything to make my stay very hassle free. The front desk are incredibly helpful and friendly, two gentlemen Michael and Michael made this the most hospitable hotel I've every stayed in. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody wanting to stay in West Hollywood/Beverly Hills area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, nice little boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JWood70
Reviews.Content: Had three nights here and the staff were fantastic. Really attentive, willing to share knowledge of the area and just generally helpful & warm. The evening mixer was a great way to meet other guests, and for us Aussies, they had Vegemite available for breakfast. Just a short stroll to Beverley Centre, which is also a stop for the Hop- on, Hop-off tour bus. The Farmers Market is a bit of a walk, but not too bad. Definitely on our list of places to stay if we come back to L.A. One thing to note though, there is no pool. That shouldn't really detract too much though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: jimbarrettsmith
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with comfortable beds, the staff were simply excellent and bent over backwards to help you whether it was booking restaurants, trips out, or changing the pillows on your bed. The complementary breakfast was excellent and the free wine and cheese in the evenings was a great way to meet other people and chat with the staff. The location is also very good, with a Macy's just a 2 minute walk away. I would stay at this hotel again without a second thought. Oh and there is free wi fi!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this place, but I really have no idea how it gets the reviews it does on here. So, starting from the top... Valet is fine - he wasn't out there when I arrived and so I waited, unsure of where you were actually supposed to pull up to for 5-10 minutes. Upon retrieving my car on other days, it took a good 15 minutes, so be sure to call down early. Check-in was fine - front desk staff is extremely nice and helpful. Rooms look good on the surface - stylish and redone fairly recently. Bed was comfy as were linens and pillows. Walls are VERY thin though. I had to run to CVS for earplugs as I could hear every word of the person in the room next to me. The balconies are also a little sketchy - I could have climbed into my neighbors room, especially since the maid undid the lock and bar that drops both days so that anyone could enter from the outside. The maid also turned on the alarm on my second day - imagine my surprise when it went off extremely early and had not the previous day. Water pressure in the shower was nice, but no fan. The continental breakfast was nothing to write home about - seriously, the Hampton Inn is better. Hardly any healthy options - mainly sugary cereals and muffins and cereal bars. A few bananas and apples and no whole grain toast or bagels. The wine and cheese was nice - surprisingly the wine wasn't the cheapest out there - it was all Penfolds. Good cheese selection too. Worst part was the lack of fitness center. They used to have an agreement with a nearby club, but its since closed and they make no mention of this on their website or when checking in. You find out early in the morning when you want to go to the gym. Come on - can't you convert one room to a fitness room?! Overall, there are many better options for the price. And frankly, if you're willing to spend just $25-50 more, you can stay at the much better Sofitel a block away.

Reviews.Title: “A true find”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our California coast tour. The hotel is in a great location, nestled between Hollywood and Beverly hills. Walking distance to the Farmers market. We stayed in a suite and it was very spacious and especially super clean! The room was right beside the elevator, but we never heard a thing, it was a very quiet room. the breakfast is quite big and has a lot of choices. The room has a coffemaker, minibar, safe and a small balcony overlooking the courtyard. The bed was very comfortable and we got little chocolates every day. The best thing is the staff, whatever the request they go out of their way to accomodate you, with a big smile on their face.Thank you Michael and Michael and Paolo. We would return here anytime we are in L.A., it's truly a find and very reasonable rates, including free wireless and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rach91177
Reviews.Content: The first stop on our one month tour of the USA and what a wonderful way to start our trip. The staff very helpful and nice. The Location perfect. The size of the room was sufficient really your on holiday ll you need is a good shower and comfy bed. The breakfast was great as well. If I come back id stay here again and I will highly reccomend any friends and famiy to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: yippeeholidays
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Elan go out of their way to make sure you are happy. The breakfast is really good and they have a coffee maker in the room. If you want to be amongst it all, near Hollywood, then this is probably out of the way. Close to Farmers Market.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: wistraveler09
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel close to restaurants and shopping. The rooms however are very small for two people to share, but they are immaculately clean and very comfortable. Although our room was close to a very busy street, there was not a lot of noise at night and sleeping was not a problem. Some sirens, but this is in the middle of the city. A nice continental breakfast is offered with the usual cereals, sweet treats and bagels and in the evening there is a nice wine and cheese reception in the lobby. Altogether a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxe in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: lalana
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be small but it's big on comfort, cleanliness and extras like the generous breakfast spread and the wine-and-cheese reception in the lobby each evening. That just leaves lunch and you're staying in the midst of some great eating spots in West Hollywood. From cheap--Jan's diner across the street, Taco Bell across the street--to pricy, you'll have no trouble finding great places to eat around this hotel. The Elan is within easy driving or walking distance from the Farmers Market. Museum District isn't far away. Beverly Center mall and other big retailers are at the end of the block. I've stayed here twice and on the second visit this spring noticed improvements in decor in the rooms and the hallways. This is a quiet, small hotel that draws older tourists, business travelers and people like me who travel solo and don't like the impersonal chill of the big chains. Free wifi in all rooms. Plus several computers and a printer provided in the lobby--great for things like printing out maps and airline paperwork. Get a room at the back and you'll have a little balcony and a view of the mansions up in the hills. There's no pool, restaurant or spa in this hotel, but for the price you get a great room with big bathroom in a prime locale with access to all the other stuff just blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “All we expected”
Reviews.Author: TempeBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in chains, but for a one night stay and based on great reviews, decided to stay here. We were not disappointed. Check in was friendly, room was stylish and afternoon wine and breakfast were good. Only negative was an internet connection problem, which a visit to the front desk fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mack_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elan for the second time, and found the service and the amenities just as nice as the first time. It's a great area to stay in, and the staff is uniformly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - great little gem”
Reviews.Author: livmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early June. Check in was a breeze. Based on reviews from this site, I was expecting a tiny room but our room was surprisingly spacious. Huge bed and very well kept and modern. Great location - very close to the Beverly Center. The nearby California Pizza Kitchen is pretty average so try elsewhere. Parking was easy although it was a bit annoying that we were charged separate transactions for each day's parking charge. Only a small thing but it means separate international transaction fees on our Aussie credit card. Breakfast was great. Didn't get a chance to try the wine and cheese. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: SilkStrawberry
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel. This was my third visit in as many years and I think it just gets better each time. This visit was with my sister and our brother is currently staying here on our recommendation. The staff are delightful and always willing to help out. The breakfast is plentiful and very much appreciated. The evening wine reception goes down a treat. The rooms are spotless and I really like the environmentally sustainable options in place with respect to towels and bed linens. And the turn-down service a nice touch. The location is excellent, especially for someone like me who loves to shop. I have the Beverley Centre in one direction and The Grove and Farmers Market in the other. And now the regentrification of 3rd Street is a bonus. I really enjoyed trying the cupcakes at Magnolia Bakery! But I should stop here, if I keep singing the praises of the Elan, I'll have to start booking a year or more in advance :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sensesawaken
Reviews.Content: I took Trip Advisors advise and tried this hotel out on my recent business trip to Los Angeles. The location was great as it was within walking distance to Beverly center Mall. There was a fast food dinner across the street. As for the hotel room, the room was a little dark and hence made reading in bed difficult. The room was a bit small and for a large bathroom, the sink was a bit small and they could have had 2 sinks on the counter. If you did not mind continental breakfast, then its great but if you are like me who needs a hearty breakfast.. then its going to be tough. One disappointing point is that there is no porters in the hotel. Hence, you need to help yourself with the bags. The hotel valet service was good as they were very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good moderate hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJGREY
Reviews.Content: I'd heard so many great things about the Elan Hotel, I was almost afraid to believe them. But happily, it is a wonderful boutique hotel with just the best service I've seen anywhere. Simple but nice breakfast in the mornings, stylish rooms, comfortable work stations. More important, I felt well-looked-after and could count on the staff if I needed anything. No restaurant, but twice when I arrived back in my room from a long, late day of work, I just ordered from Jerry's, an excellent diner that delivers.

Reviews.Title: “My "Business" Medical Trip”
Reviews.Author: Roxymusic4
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience staying at the Elan hotel from 5/9 -5/13 during my medical visits to Cedars-Sinai (only a few blocks away). My room was an "Executive King", very nicely appointed, quiet, with balcony and a beautiful view. The room included an honor bar, flat screen TV, computer hook -up, hair dryer, etc. The staff welcomed me and did their best to make my stay comfortable. They succeeded! I enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts and wine and cheese receptions during which I met other guests from a variety of places, near and quite far away. Elan is a small "boutique" hotel that provided a cozy environment which helped ease my anxiety concerning my medical trip to LA. There are eateries of all kinds nearby as well as shops and the Beverly Center. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal for Business Travelers in Town!”
Reviews.Author: skrecke
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how pleased I am to report the service and quality of this hotel has not changed in the five years since I stayed last. I was in town for a business event and was booked at a rather shoddy hotel down the road that proved unacceptable. A quick call to the Elan and they sent a cab for both me and coworker, let us check in early, and didn't bat an eye when I asked if I could check out late the next day. The hotel is very modern zen, just a few blocks from the Beverly Center, offers valet parking, and truly embodies a modern boutique hotel mentality. The staff is very hands-on, the free wine from 5-7 every night finds you striking up new friendships in the lounge, and the unbelievable price keeps you coming back -- for me it continues to be a perfect option every time I visit L.A. The only critique I can truly muster is the fact that my room was close to the lobby and the cleaning staff got a way too early of a start right outside my door. As a wedding editor I see and review a lot of hotels, so believe me when I say the Elan is a must for business travelers, mature wedding guests visiting from out of town, singles and couples looking to explore the city, and shopaholics who desire a centralized location for both Beverly Hills and Melrose boutiquing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentative staff & walking distance to everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: caymindiver
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews. I don't understand the negativity. Its a "botique" hotel experience. Its a lovely hotel. They allowed me a late check out. Staying here for a week. In the center of WeHo. Safe area. I walk every night by myself & I am a small statuted female. The staff is super nice & accommodating. Only valey parking but this is WeHo you know. The reviews stated the rooms were small. Ok so they are, but unless it's more than 2 people staying over well I just don't see the problem. I would stay here again & my comparisons are based upon being very well travelled.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent choice in L.A”
Reviews.Author: schloo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TA reviews and weren't disappointed. I have been to L.A before, and cannot stand the madness of the main centre of town. Elan Hotel is in a great location on Beverly, just a 5 min walk down the road from the Beverly Center shopping mall, and all the streets close by seemed to have nice quirky boutique shops and restaurants. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, even providing a list of restaurants they recommended in the area (and a price guide, so you could see the types of restaurants by budget). We ate at two fantastic restaurants, a Japanese one which I can't remember the name of now, and Little Next door, a lovely French place. Breakfast selections were great, I particularly liked the homemade sweet bread, though unfortunately I only caught it once, it was missing from the breakfast bar a couple of mornings so I can only assume others got there before me! If I had to make a suggestion for this hotel it would be to leave a dedicated recycling bin in rooms. I liked the hotel's dedication to conserving and recycling, and there is a polite notice in bathrooms asking guests to leave their recyclables out to staff to take away, but I did not feel comfortable with leaving out all my dirty rubbish in the room, I would have rather had a separate bin to store it in. Also the WiFi signal was useless, half the time (mainly in mornings and evenings) it didn't work. Overall a great hotel, and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Denied reservation because of service dog for my disabled father”
Reviews.Author: Maxxodd
Reviews.Content: I was not allowed to reserve a room because I was accompanied by my father who has a disability requiring a service dog. I was told over the phone that the hotel has a blanket policy that no "pets" are allowed. I politely informed the gentleman I was speaking to that service animals are not considered pets. He replied that it didn't matter. Needless to say, I am disappointed by their non-compliance with the law: Section 54.2(a), Right of individuals with disabilities to be accompanied by a trained service dog

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BrotherSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for 5 days in April. What a wonderful hotel this is. We have stayed in hotels accross the world and this is one of the best - it rates highly for customer service. Every member of staff we encountered had a smile and cheeful greeting for us, the valets in particular were very friendly. The location on beverley Boulevard is perfect for getting around LA and has many good restaurants on the doorstep. We liked Jan's Coffee shop across the road and Swingers which was just up the road. The hotel room was lovely, really clean and comfortable with a coffee maker, robes, balcony and each day a chocolate and weather card was left in the room - a nice touch. If i had a minor criticism(and it is minor) the bathroom could do with some shelves to store your toilet bags, make up bags etc. The hotel provided a free continental breakfast which was good - muffins, juices, cereal, croissants and good coffee.But the icing on the cake(as well as the free wifi) was the evening wine and cheese reception - a lovely treat when we came in each evening. Good quality wine and cheeses served from 5 - 7pm. Really enjoyable. All in all a fantastic stay with a really good atmosphere, wonderful customer service and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at this hotel is the best experienced in America”
Reviews.Author: perthtraveller69
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel bend over backwards to please. The hotel is about a $17 taxi fare from the attractions of LA but far enough away to be peaceful. Rooms are really quite small but clean and well presented. Great value hotel for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: miatennis
Reviews.Content: The location was great for travelling with teenager. You are located within walking distance from the Beverly Center which has great stores. There are a number of good restaurants withing walking distance from the hotel. Also, in the evening it is fun to take a short drive to the Grove which is a fun outdoor shopping area full of restaurants and great shops adjacent to the farmer's market. It is a great people watching place which is beautifully lit in the evening. The staff was so friendly when we arrived. They offer great cheeses and snacks from 5-7pm in their lounge with wine. The rooms are not big but adequate. This is clearly more of a small boutique hotel experience located on a busy street. The beds were comfortable. Parking is expensive but so it is everywhere when you are in the city. You must valet and it is $24 a night. However, they were very quick in retrieving your car whenever you need it. I would recommend staying here for those who like to shop and explore the funky restaurant scene.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Hotel deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: This boxy hotel on a busy street nonetheless feels innovative and personal. It is adapted for 21st century travelers, skipping the unused add-ons (in house restaurant, glam lobby) but providing all of the details I look for in a room -- reliable free internet, big enough closet with lots of hangers (11); coffee maker; alarm clock with big display of the time, iron, toiletries, decent pillows, and windows that open. The free breakfast buffet, which provided healthy choices, and smiling desk staff made the hotel a convenient bargain as well. The turn down service turned the clock radio on to the local NPR classical mustc station, which clinched my five star rating. Only price complaint is cost of parking, but given the outsourced valet model, it worked pretty well. There are lots of options and lots of neighborhoods in LA, but the Elan fit my needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in LA”
Reviews.Author: GBLTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I spent 15 nights at the Elan over two stays. We were attending to a family member who was at Cedars-Sinai Hospital. The people and the facilty of the Elan could not have been nicer. A small boutique hotel with a warm and welcoming attitude. Under the circumstances we were looking for a haven and the Elan provided that. Their complimentary breakfast and evening wine were a perfect beginning end to each day. The rooms are ample and the amenities are perfect. A great choice for a stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: 411Vacationer
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel has both pros and cons. The pros are that it is locaed within walking distance of good restaurants and the hotel will provide a list. It is convenient to a shopping center and Cedars Sinai. Wine and cheese are offered in the afternoons and a continental breakfast is offered until 10 AM. The lobby is nice appointed. The cons are that it located next to an auto tire service and there are no views. The guest rooms are small and resemble an updated rooming house. The hotel is clean. Parking is expensive with only valet service available - no self-park. In my opinion, this is a 2 star hotel with an expensive price point for the room. The internet is unreliable and quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our LA Stay”
Reviews.Author: CPA52
Reviews.Content: We chose Elan based on Tripadvisor reviews and for being within walking distance to our daughter whilst visiting her in LA. We had 2 bookings for 3 and 4 days with a break in between but on checking-in I asked if these bookings could be changed as circumstances had changed and we wanted to stay for 7 nights straight, this was not a problem and we were given the same parking package we had booked some 8 months prior. Our room faced Beverly Blvd and I was first worried about noise but it was surprisingly quiet. Breakfast was included and more than sufficent for our needs the vegemite was appreciated. The Wine and Cheese each evening is also a nice touch, we were surprised they offered Australian wines. Elan is within easy walking distance to The Grove, Farmers Markets and many Restaurants. Cafe Sushi on next corner has great food and good value we ate there twice during our stay. The Beverly Centre is only a 5 minute walk. All staff were professional, pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: contactnatalia
Reviews.Content: The stay in Elan hotel was one of the best I've had! Despite being a three star - Room facilities here is so amazing and even exceeded many of the four stars hotels I've ever stayed in. Free internet and a big flat TV are a big plus to the room. I found that hotels in the US don't usually provide room fridges unles requested but this one came with a nice little fridge filled with products that have reasonable prices unlike those hotels that charge you an arm and a leg for their mini bars. We love the little nice gesture of the weather card we receive on the bed every day with two little pieces of chocolates. I also won't forget to mention that the room was exceptionally clean! All Elan staff were very friendly, helpful and warm - they were always ready to help out! I will difinitely recommend this hotel to everyone! Elan - two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEETHEBEST
Reviews.Content: I booked the Elan Hotel in LA in a large part due to the reviews on Trip Advisor. However, I do not understand why it is rated so highly. The location was very good, the rooms were clean, the staff was excellent in terms of being service-oriented and polite, and there was free wi-fi and use of computers and a printer in the lobby. But, the breakfast (included) was poor, especially regarding the quality of certain items available, and the "turn-down" service actually occurred when the housekeeper initially serviced the room in the latter part of the day Also, if you decide to take advantage of the valet parking, be sure to inspect your car after it is delivered to you. Overall, this hotel seems to be an old one that was slightly modernized and is attempting to be in a higher class than it actually is. (Some staff members have multiple roles.) The price charged per room is excessive for such a hotel, as is the fact that it is rated #2 in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Beverly Hills/ West Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: giboss
Reviews.Content: Very helpful & friendly staff. Nicely appointed, tastefully decorated without being drab or overly gaudy. Extended continental breakfast & evening wine&cheese social helps to make this a real bargain for the area. Although I had a room facing Beverly Blvd, it was surprisingly quiet. I would stay there again & recommend it for friends, family

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: speedbird41
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning, to catch a city tour, and received a warm welcome. We were offered a twin bedded room immediately but we wanted the king bedded room we had booked so our bags were stored without fuss. We were then invited to help ourselves to the complimentary breakfast despite not really checking in until later in the day. The tour hotel pick-up was late and the receptionist was straight on the phone making sure we had not been forgotten. After the tour we returned to find our bags in the room. The room was slightly small, as previously commented on, but more than adequate as you don't visit LA to sit in your room. It was at the rear of the hotel which shielded us from most of the traffic noise out front although the hotel is near a major medical facility. However, the inter-room noise insulation is not too good. If you like a firm bed you are in luck, it was probably the firmest hotel bed we have experienced in a long while but we slept well. The hotel location is very good if you are inclined to walk but the nearest metro bus stop is a good 10 minutes walk in either direction. It took about an hour to walk to Hollywood Blvd (Kodak theatre) and about 40 minutes to Rodeo Dr or the Farmers Market. You also have restaurant row within 5-10 minute walk with a good choice of cuisine from around the world. Overall, the hotel is very clean, in a great location and the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. If we were to visit LA again this is the hotel we would use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff at this Nice Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MollyIN
Reviews.Content: The Elan is a great boutique hotel with excellent, responsive service and is a good value for the area. The rooms are clean, the continental breakfast is tasty and everyone who works here is really nice and wants to help you out. The front desk people gave me outstanding driving directions for a better route that cut-off 20 minutes in LA traffic to my business meeting! Thank you for a pleasant visit -- I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE BEST - PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: mrhavis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Elan many times during the past 3 years. Consistently, they have extended the best service and value possible. The location is perfect. The rooms are perfect. The rate is perfect. And most importantly, the people are perfect. Obviously, I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “From a Cedars-Sinai patient perspective...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugJ9
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Elan hotel because I was coming in from NJ to have a series of procedures at Cedars Sinai. So, my caveat to anyone reading this review is that I'm reviewing this hotel based on my experience as a patient and less as a tourist or someone traveling for business. I stayed at the Elan for 7 nights with my mother and husband in a 2 dbl bedroom. I will be staying at the hotel again for a follow-up visit to Cedars Sinai. However, depending on what you are going in for this may or may not be the option for you. Here are the pros and cons of staying at this hotel as a patient: PROS: 1) extremely close to hospital; w/in walking distance or a cheap, short cab ride ($5) if need be; 2) staff is extremely courteous and prompt if you have any issues w/ the room; 3) rooms are extremely clean!!! as a patient, i found this to be very important; 4) beds are very comfortable, also very important if you are recovering from something; 5) free breakfast in the morning - not a hot breakfast, but plenty of great things to eat which was very convenient and a major cost-savings 6) although they don't have a restaurant onsite, they do have a deli that delivers often to the site in case you want to eat in; 7) if you don't want to eat in, there are plenty of restaurants nearby to eat in or get take-out (note: just prior to my procedure, we ate at Grand Lux Cafe only a short walk away, and all 3 of us contracted major food poisoning!!!!!!!!!!! this almost jeopardized my entire purpose out there. Fortunately, we were so close to the hospital, so my mom & I were able to get to the ER very quickly with a cab that the hotel called for us. But don't eat at the Grand Lux!!!; 8) there is a refrigerator in the room as well as a microwave to reheat any leftovers 9) free wifi - which was great for my husband since he worked from the hotel while I was back and forth to the hospital; 10) we had a slight problem w/ our room and needed to switch after a day or 2. As a tourist, the problems (described below) wouldn't have bothered me too much, but since I was a patient and spending a lot of time in the room, they became important. Due to the inconvenience of having to switch rooms, the hotel actually comped us 1 night - which was extremely generous; 11) whenever we needed transportation anywhere, there was a cab waiting within minutes. CONS: 1) if you are staying there for an extended period of time, you may want a kitchenette which this hotel does not offer; 2) the wifi wasn't always the best and neither was cell service, but it's free, so can't complain; 3) we had some slight problems w/ our bathtub drain backing up and the keys were tempermental - sometimes they worked, sometimes they didn't, so we went through lots of keys. But the hotel made up for this (see #10 above) So, as you could see, I thought the Elan was a great choice for my purpose. As I mentioned before, I plan on staying there again for a follow-up visit. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Even when we did experience problems, they took them seriously, were prompt in trying to fix them, but offered for us to switch rooms (which we did) and still comped us 1 night. THAT is good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelperson97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan Hotel for 5 nights. The room was clean and comfortable.They had several computers for guests' use. The breakfast was excellent. We also enjoyed the wine and snacks each afternoon. We had a rental car which they parked for us underneath the building. The fee for parking did not increase, no matter how many times we left and returned each day. The staff was particularly helpful and responsive. Overall, a great value. We would definitely stay at the Elan again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chase62
Reviews.Content: This is the equivalent of a good 3 star hotel. However, the location for under $200 makes it well worth it. It is 1 block from the Beverly Shopping Centre, blocks from the Grauman Theatre, Hollywood Blvd, Sunset Strip, the Tar Pits, Walk of Fame, Paramount & NBC Studios, etc. etc. The rooms are clean, quiet and roomy. The hotel is well maintained, free internet, a good breakfast included and the staff friendly. Valet parking is$20 a day but it is secure and the valet is readily available. One less headache to worry about. It is a safe neighbourhood with numerous restaurants of all types nearby. I will be returning and I don't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay, highly recommed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinoBella
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel in a great location. Joel and his friendly and helpful staff were excellent and didn't disappoint. Delicious breakfast, generous wine and cheese reception and free wifi is a nice touch. Well appointed rooms, clean and spacious bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows. The hotel is walking distance to a number of great cafes and restaurants as well as the Farmer's Market. Voted the best hotel by the family in our month long travel around the West Coast. We stayed at the Elan at the start of our trip and again at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: AussieAdverturers
Reviews.Content: We (parents and 16yo) recently travelled through California and British Columbia. The Elan was universally voted as our favourite hotel (and we rarely agree on anything). The service (front desk and support staff) and amenities were excellent. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and well appointed with everything you would need. The costs were more than reasonable. The location in West Beverly Hills was ideal for all the major attractions with the only downside being the Elan is very near the Beverly Centre where we dutifully dissipated all the savings we made by choosing the Elan in the post-Xmas sales. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, hotel located near Beverly Center”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Beverly Center. The hotel is new and the rooms are nice and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in LA”
Reviews.Author: chager77
Reviews.Content: The good is for sure the localisation of the hotel. The staff was nice and helpfull. The bad point is that we were there in february and we could not turn the air condition off! The room was chilli and the air condition was still blowing cold air inside.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Hotel Service in my 30 years of traveling”
Reviews.Author: CHILLYWILLY1_11
Reviews.Content: Joel's team of professional staff members is not to be overlooked. Their attention to detail and our comfort was excellent. I knew my wife would be looked after during her medical treatments at a nearby hospital. They did not dissapoint. They brought her flowers when they thought she was inconvenienced by some minor upgrades scheduled for the rooms. They knew our names, cleaned rooms around her schedule, valeted our car to our needs and made great restaurant recommendations. They can be proud of their personnel and property.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiaora7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December for one night and again in January. I was passing through L.A. The hotel is clean, quiet and the beds are very comfortable but I wouldn't stay there again. The first visit was just to rest overnight before going on to New York but I had more time in L.A. the second time, although again I only stayed one night. It was raining when I arrived at the hotel and I struggled up the hotel steps with 2 pieces of luggage. Only when I got inside the building was I asked if I wanted help with my bags. Not a big deal but I didn't like the snotty attitude of the person on the front desk thereafter. The hotel is very 70's decor and apart from being close to the Beverley Shopping centre, I just didn't like it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: SandBTokyo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of January and do highly recommend this hotel. The location is quite good. It is very close to Beverly Center shopping mall, about 5 minutes walk, as well as a short walk to both Melrose Avenue and 3rd street. There are shops and restaurants in this area. The surrounding side streets are nice residential neighborhoods. The main Hollywood sites are a short drive away. The Elan hotel is small, only 2 floors, but is very comfortable and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we always felt like valued guests. The breakfast spread was nice, as was as the wine and cheese spread in the evenings which was a very nice treat to help relax when we returned from our site-seeing. The lobby area was very nice. The rooms although not big were very clean and comfortable, with all the necessary facilities including free WiFi, good size bathroom and great king-sized bed. I took the advice from the reviews and requested a room on the 2nd floor away from the elevator, so it was really quiet. I arranged airport pick-up and drop-off through the hotel. The cost was $55 each way. The driver was named Cesar and his service was excellent. We really liked this boutique hotel, very much enjoyed staying at the Elan. The price was good and the quality was excellent. They do all the little things right. I give the Elan full marks and definitely recommend them as a great place to stay when in LA, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A small Hotel with a BIG service!!! Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Petros38
Reviews.Content: A small hotel but with the quality, customer service and excellent service you would expect from any 5* plus hotel. The room was as good as any we have ever had, and we have traveled world-wide. Well done, to the staff and management of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights in this Hotel even though staying only one full night because we had a late departure back home to Australia. The service desk was very welcoming on arrival and very thorough in explaining hotel inclusions breakfast, wine and cheese evenings and free internet as well as where everthing was in relation to hotel - local sights etc. The room with two double beds was very clean and comfortable enough ,although small ,with seperate bathroom equally as small but a nice touch with bathrobes and slippers available. Unfortunately our room was close to the lift and we were woken a couple of times that night by loud people coming and going from their room. Inconsideration from other guests cannot be blamed on the hotel but guest experience all adds up to additional stays! We were given a key to the bar fridge and did have some drinks from it. On check-out we were told we did not owe anything as our room had been pre-paid, we let them know we had utilised the bar fridge and presented the filled out list of beverages consumed. On settling the bill we were not only taxed for the beverages but charged a surcharge as well. That was a new one on us- a charge for getting a drink from the fridge!!! As we had arrived by super shuttle to the hotel and had not been pleased with this arrangement I asked about a taxi for the following evening. One was booked for us and I was told it would cost us 45USD because it had been booked through the hotel. The taxi was spot on time but the driver was quick to let us know the fare was 50USD ,which I paid and tipped accordingly. I would be interested to know who got that one wrong. Location of The Elan was fantastic and close to some nice places to eat. Overall I was very pleased with my choice of hotel and would love to stay again for a little longer to take advantage of all the inclusions but definately not in a room near the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: labgal90210
Reviews.Content: The Elan was recommended to me by friends and recently stayed there one night before going on a cruise. I live in the LA area (in the Valley) and wanted to be closer to the port...what a pleasant surprise!! Elan was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in - the staff was very accomodating, the cleaniness of the room was superb and the wine and cheese buffet was an added touch of class to an already pleasant stay. For anyone looking for a hotel in the L.A. area, I'd highly recommend the Elan

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: zephyreno
Reviews.Content: After staying at Elan 4 days per week for 2 years from 2006-2008 I recently had the occasion to revisit the hotel. I was again reminded of the wonderful service, the unparraleled staff and general warm ambiance of the hotel. From the General Manager, Joel, his back office Manager, William, to the rest of the staff I was reminded how extraordinary this hotel is in terms of service and concern for their guests. The rooms are attractive, comfortable and nicely appointed. The complimentary breakfast and wine reception a plus and the room rates for this upscale area are terrrific, but what sets Elan apart is their care for their guests. I've travelled extensively and have never experienced the kind of genuine interest and regard the staff has for its guests at any other hotel. I've recommended Elan to my friends and family, many have stayed there, taking away with them the same opinion as I have.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: WickWick
Reviews.Content: You are met by a delightful staff at the car and front desk. Though the rooms are a bit small, they are well equipped (beyond our expectations - nice sheets and thick soft towels) and quite clean and comfortable. The afternoon wine and cheese in the appealing lobby was a bonus feature along with a satisfying continental breakfast the next morning. The best asset of this hotel is its staff. Would absolutely stay again and recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel! Friendly ++, great location”
Reviews.Author: tp42
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights near the Thanksgiving weekend. I've never encountered friendlier staff, from the valet to the concierge! All smiles and welcomes and very helpful with information for visiting Aussie travelers. The rooms are a little small, but we didn't plan to be spending much time besides overnight in them and the bed was VERY comfortable. Room was nicely decorated and very clean. They also do a complimentary wine and cheese every evening which was a nice way to wind into the night. Breakfast was more than adequate and far better than anything we've had since. There's dining and shopping close by. We've booked ourselves to stay again at the end of our trip before flying out of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Movie Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: JCinDenver
Reviews.Content: Finding the Elan Hotel in LA was a little problematic due to construction and street signs initially difficult to follow. Beverly Boulevard is complicated, because it winds around and there's a "boulevard" and a "drive." Once we found it-- and made our way to the desk-- five star service began! From Omar's help getting our computer properly up and running, to the "manager's reception," a happy hour that will get your evening off to a great start, this group of young people were all about making our stay as easy as possible. We were two couples in LA for just shy of 2 days before we took an overnight flight to Australia. Our goal was to be ready to fly abroad, spend a little time in the city, enjoy LA, then clean-up up and board our 11:50 p.m. flight. The Elan staff made sure to stow our luggage for the better part of the 2nd day of our LA time and the day of our flight and-- are you ready for this-- let us borrow a small single unit to shower and dress for our flight. The suites we stayed in were roomy and wonderful-- if you were on your own and really didn't need the space of a suite, then this tiny room would be okay, but honestly, it was almost difficult just to bring wheeled duffle bags into the single unit. It definitely served the purpose, but this would not be a chosen room for a couple. There was no charge for the borrowed room-- and it made all the difference in the world-- before boarding such a long flight. We have nothing but praise for the Elan Hotel and the staff. It was a great time, with location being perfect for the places we wanted to visit-- 1) Sushi Katsu-ya (best sushi in LA-- our 2nd visit-- from Denver, Co!) and 2) the Getty Museum. Stay here anytime you want to be treated like a MOVIE STAR-- this is a great place to stay-- and the staff is FIRST RATE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly staff, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: cmehend
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to Beverly Hills and Hollywood Blvd. The staff is very nice. Our rooms were nice, but very small. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, value, care, convenience”
Reviews.Author: Kesla
Reviews.Content: After researching MANY hotels in the area, I chose Elan due to its reasonable price (given the market) and convenience to local places of interest. Compared to other hotels in the area that charged for Internet (theirs was free and computers were available at no charge in their lobby area) and had exorbitant parking fees (Elan's was only $19 per night compared to many others that were $40 per night) I thought that I should give Elan a try. I am happy I did. It was a block away from the Beverly Center, less than a mile from The Grove and Farmer's Market and was easily accessible to many wonderful restaurants. The hotel itself offered a nice continental breakfast and in the late afternoon a decent offering of wines, salami, and cheeses. Though the rooms are small, they pack a lot of comfort into that space and offered extra touches such as an LCD TV, additional pillows, and chocolates awaiting us upon our return in the evening. They were also very clean. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Given that our room was between $100 - $300 less than similar hotels in the area that didn't offer anything except a place to stay for the night, I was absolutely satisfied with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: 43Saul
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Clean, newly renovated and a great valet service for $19 per night. The twin queen was a little small but nothing really to worry about. Stayed for 3 nights and one of the nights I was woken by a few guys coming in around 2am. Not the hotels fault. All in all I would recommend this hotel for anyone that likes/enjoys the modern feel of a clean hotel with hype location. Beverly centre is just opposite corner. Staff are friendly and the hotel offers a free wine and cheese reception each evening between 5 and 7. I would stay here again especially if I was a couple or staying with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice breakfast, luggage hold service”
Reviews.Author: Initaurus
Reviews.Content: It started terrible as we booked an airport pick-up through the hotel, but no one turned up. Our flight arrived a half hour early so we waited then contacted the hotel, which their contact phone number was missing '1' in front, thus the public phone consumed our coins twice! After a police officer told us to add '1' in front of the phone number, we got though but the staff said the pick-up was a couple minutes away, but no one turned up at the end. We wasted another a half hour and took a cab to the hotel instead. The hotel staff apologied and gave us $25 free minibar credits so it was alright. Our room was on the first floor so breakfast setting noise woke us up every morning around between 5:30 and 6am. Breakfast was on the first floor lounge area. We specifically requested a quite room and the hotel confirmed, but it was not a quite room. We could also hear sound from the next door and the room above. I am quite amazed all 3 hotels we stayed during this trip had thin walls. Least thing you would want while staying a hotel is hearing people talking and tv sound from the next door or above!! Complementary breakfast was great, please note though it was not hearty breakfast as my partner expected. Only bakery, cereal, yogurt and coffee/tea. Their luggage holding service was really good so thumbs up for that. The staff were very friendly including the doormen. Overall, I would stay this hotel again if I could get a room on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian”
Reviews.Author: BinaryNomad
Reviews.Content: Clean, good location, decent prices (for this area), but utilitarian. The rooms are small and plain with no view, the internet is slow, the halls are grim and look like something from a chain motel. No self-parking available, street parking is either metered or by permit only, and the valet parking verges on highway robbery at $19/day since there is no alternative. The buffet breakfast is all cold food. The hospital describes itself as "boutique" but I would describe it more as a slightly-upscale Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: xls1x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in oct 2010. Location we thought wasn't too bad as we mainly went to Hollywood blvd (10 min taxi ride) and got tours from there. The rooms were of a good size, clean and bed was great. Free wifi was a plus! All hotel staff were very nice with the standout of one employee who went out of his way to help us out. I didn't get his name but he was a shorter guy with glasses. He was a champ, We were unlucky not to see him at checkout because we wanted to thank him for his help. All up I would say it was an enjoyable stay and probably one of the best we stayed at while in the US.8/10

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel and good value, but surely not the best in LA”
Reviews.Author: AC-Elite
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Elan twice in 2010, and both times the hotel met my expectations. The hotel is very well-located, the staff are pleasant and the rooms are clean. The evening wine is a nice touch and the breakfast, while fairly basic, is absolutely adequate. I did find the bathrooms on both occasions very very small, and on both occasions the hotel was undergoing some form of internal renovations (wet paint signs up, missing carpet etc). Outside of the lobby, the hotel does feel a little soul-less and while I'm usually a disciple of TripAdvisor, I'm not sure what all the hype is about with this hotel. It's decent, good value for money and in a good part of LA, but it is certainly not "oh my goodness, I've found nirvana" territory.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in LA!”
Reviews.Author: DomCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a room on the 3rd floor with 2 beds. Overall a great place to stay in LA that does not disappoint! Pros: - the best location in LA! Right in the middle of West Hollywood: short walk to shopping malls including The Grove, close to Melrose Ave, quick cab ride a way from West Hollywood bars and clubs - comfortable room & surprisingly quiet at night - excellent free continental breakfast - reasonably priced valet parking - excellent service throughout Cons: - can't really think of one, but just remember that this is not a 5 star resort or anything like that

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was absolutely perfect, rooms, service, hospitality,price, it has it all.”
Reviews.Author: twistedeyes
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Elan. The rooms are tastefully decorated and beautifully appointed with all the comforts of home and more. The location is excellent, walking distance to the Farmers Market and Beverley hills Shopping Centre. The breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese was delicious and fresh and generous. It was a great way to meet other guests. This is a really classy hotel, great value for money,. The valet parking made it very easy and we walked both nights of our stay to local restaurants , a vegetarian and a japanses that were excellent value .

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: RelentlessTraveller2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in West Hollywood on Beverly Bl., right acroos from the Beverly Centre. Our room was a decent size but we had to move after the first night because we fronted Beverly Bl and the traffic noise was really bad. The room had a door opening onto the balcony and no sound proofing. To make it worse during our stay there was road construction at the time which started early. Our next room was around the back on the lobby level and much quieter. The bed was a little firm for my liking. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast was quite good and the afternoon complimentary wine and cheese made it feel homely. I would stay again but request a room away from the street. Parking is by valet only which adds another $20 to the room bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maci0202
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a good location in Beverly Hills. Shopping Centre (Macy's) just across the road, and so is the bus stop for the Tourist Bus to take you on a Hollywood tour! The staff were one of the friendliest we've come across, really going that extra mile to accommodate you. Underground parking with a free valet service. The rooms are extremely small, but how much time do you spend inside when you're in LA? Even though the hotel is right on the street, the rooms are very quiet so you get decent sleep. The hotel is also well known to the taxi drivers, which is always a good thing... Not a bad breakfast, however, no formal dining area, so can get a bit crowded in the foyer. We ran into Eric Bana in the supermarket across the road, so yeah, hotel highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel, central location no crowds great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Peter631
Reviews.Content: A little more expensive than some hotels but after a long flight the personal service and quality of the rooms was a refreshing surprise. It was everything that we had hoped for. Close to some great shopping and just a short bus ride from Rodeo Drive, Hollywood Blvd and other hot spots. Be sure you check out the Farmers Market. Its not that far away and well worth the time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Diva_8
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Los Angelas, this was our last stop on our world tour honeymoon. The Elan had a somewhat dated feel to it in comparison to other hotels in LA but it ticked all boxes (except I had the impression it was better located then it actually was). We didnt need to drive on our honeymoon but really regretted not bringing our licences as to get a cab from the Elan to Universal was almost €50 using the hotel's local cab service, and in general cabs are expensive because its such a big town). No fault of the hotel's though of course. 20mins stroll to the farmer's market which was great. 5mins to Beverley Centre. Room's we're clean, comfortable, quite nice to hang in after a day of tours. Staff had the 'american friendlyness' (too formal!), but thats not necessarily a bad thing I guess, they we're curtious and VERY helpful. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent service, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: favourite_star
Reviews.Content: The Elan Hotel was the first stop on our trip around california and we were extremely comfortable there. Sure, it isn't cheap but it is worth it for the lovely rooms, friendly attentive service, pleasant free breakfast, cheese and wine evenings, free wireless. At first we thought the $19 parking fee was a lot, but based on what we paid in other cities it's not too bad. We would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Wendi9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on our way back to New Zealand, and decided to stay here after reading all the good reviews on T.A.Most of which was said is true, although I found the room fairly average, but beautifully clean and tidy, also the 5pm free wine and cheese afternoons are GREAT, you meet some lovely people. Hi to the 2 guys who worked in the movies and the 2 honeymooners from England! Overall is was a great place to stay and will be even better when they finish building Taco Bell across the road.......very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjbarbour
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small, but it was in a decent location, clean, and the free breakfast was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Mack_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elan only one night, but--having stayed at other hotels on the west side of Los Angeles,--I can say the Elan is the best. In general it's a nice place, fairly priced and with great amenities and service. One example: I asked the front desk early in the morning for coins to go outside and get a newspaper. The fellow at the desk said: "sir, we'll get that for you, and he immediately sent the bell man to fetch me a paper."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: JDLondon_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Elan for two nights on their shopping package which was definitely worth the money. The location of the hotel is great in a safe neighbourhood, lots of restaurants nearby and just a few minutes from the Beverly Centre and the stop for the hop on, hop off bus tour. The breakfast was very good, plenty of choice and lots of it. The rooms themselves are very well equipped, modern and comfortable. Our only negative point was that we were at the front of the hotel and right next to the valet garage and the clanking of the garage shutter as cars were taken in and out often woke us up. I imagine if you were at the rear of the hotel it would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: BeanBlossom
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with the Elan Hotal when I stayed for a Friday and Saturday night in August. (I was in LA to visit a sick newborn grandniece at the Cedars Sinai Hospital NICU, and the Elan Hotel offers discounts for those of us visiting hospital patients. The Hotel is a quick walk to Cedars.) The entire staff was marvelous, extremely kind; they arranged a taxi to pick me up the airport on Friday night: very much appreciated. The hotel itself is so clean that it sparkled (seriously). My room was fantastic: clean, shiny, very pleasing; furniture and decorating was super, bed was extremely comfortable; bathroom was huge. Very quiet. Breakfast was wonderful: so many choices of pastries, breads, teas, and all on china dishes and regular silverware (no plastic stuff). The landscaping is great, too. I was personally grateful for the outside smoking area with tables and chairs: I wasn't made to feel like a pariah, as I am in most places. (Yes, I know I should quit.) I have been spoiled now, and will now compare other hotels to the Elan. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We can't rate this hotel highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: Shellsta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for four nights during a two week visit to Los Angeles and it was undoubtedly a highlight of our holiday. Our expectations were pretty high thanks to the reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. Our room was comfortable, stylish and had everything we could want (even windows that open, and as we were at the rear of the hotel, we had wonderfully peaceful sleeps), and the location is fantastic! We booked under a special deal being offered at the time which including parking (the valet was a delight), breakfast (simple but very good), evening wine and cheese, free internet access, and a shopping voucher valued at $25 for every night we stayed. Which made the whole experience even more wonderful, considering the exceptional value for money. There was a bit of maintenance work going on around our room during daylight hours, but the workmen were as discreet as possible and very polite so it was never an issue. Overall, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: TerrigalExplorer
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 month old baby and I had the pleasure of staying at the Elan for 4 days from 5 September. We booked the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The service is excellent with the hotel employees more than willing to assist with directions and attractions. The location is fantastic. We were able to walk to The Beverly Center, Melrose Place and the trendy 3rd Street. The breakfast was also much appreciated and something we definitely missed in the next hotels on our trip. If you decide to stay at the Elan, be sure to check out Marshalls across the road for bargain designer clothes a well as the Farmers Market for lovely international food. We will definitely be staying at the Elan Hotel on our next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lisasamson2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with friendly staff always ready to help. The room was quite spacious and spotlessly clea and the bed was much more comfortable than the one I have at home :-) Thank you for a good tip

Reviews.Title: “Really really hard to come up with something bad to say about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RR_USA
Reviews.Content: The good: Great location; tremendously friendly and helpful staff; layout, amenities and cleanliness of the Executive King Room are excellent; good (complimentary) in-room wifi and lobby pc's; good breakfast; and the (complimentary) cheese & wine reception every evening is a really nice touch. The bad: The only thing that we noticed that could be improved was the outdated hallway (in comparison with the lobby and rooms), but even this was being refurbished while we were there (with minimal disruptions by the way)! Verdict: For us, it was the best hotel in a 5-week vacation; will definitely stay here again when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Tecolate
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Elan, and it was just as pleasant as the first visit. The hotel is within walking distance of nice restaurants and shopping. The surrounding residential areas appear upscale and safe. A nice touch in the Elan is that the room doors have slow closings, such that doors do not slam on their own. Thus the hotel is relatively quiet, unless there is loud talking outside your door. Worth mentioning is that internet access is free, but parking is not. And there are few safe alternatives for parking that would cost less. With free parking I would give this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money, but, doubtful I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: brodyboy0225
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to say that The Elan is a very neat small hotel. The staff was accomodating, enjoyed the complimentary breakfast bar/coffee & evening reception of wine & cheese. My drawback was the size of the room. I have to admit, I was shocked when I walked in the room. The room we stayed in was VERY small. However, I've not stayed in any boutique hotels, so I don't have any comparison. I prefer a larger sized room with a large bathroom. So, if you're expecting luxurious - forget it. Really, the staff & the general "feel" of the place made the experience more comfortable. I can see why it's rated so high, but, it's just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “No. 1 on Trip Advisor must say something.”
Reviews.Author: morgans_berriew
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA having booked a bed and breakfast for 4 nights it was so horrendous that we left after one night and trawled through our Lonely Planet guide and ended up with this gem. Every cloud has a silver lining. We didnt even mind the valet parking fee cause Paulo was very pleasant. Had 2 different rooms because that was the only way they could accomodate us 2nd night was suite. Rooms comfortable clean and no complaints at all. Breakfast very good plenty of fresh food pastries juice and coffee. Free internet location good what more can we say. This place thankfully restored our faith in LA which had started off rather badly.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, you couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: knhAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great botique hotel, with very friendly staff and small personal touches. The 5-7 pm wine and cheese experience is great and does not start at 5.01 and finish at 6.59 pm. We arrived after pick up at the airport 7.30 pm and were still able to enjoy a complimentary glass of wine as a night cap... When I contacted to hotel by e-mail they not only gave me a great rate they also booked a driver for us at a good price, making the late arrival from Australie and transfer to the hotel from the airport a breeze! The staff is friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is great, they even have Vegamite! Every day when you return to your room there is a note with the weather forecast for the next day and a chocolate. This really is a great small boutique hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SAMLisbon
Reviews.Content: I always imagine that a great hotel should be a large hotel, Elan proved me that I was deeply wrong. How can a small one have such an excellent service? You got to go there to believe it. The staff, the rooms, the location, the service, the rates… everything is amazing. My Honeymoon was, in did, more beautiful because of them. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: Sal056
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights at the start of a 5 week trip up the West coast of the U.S. We found the area very central (we had a rental car) for getting to Hollywood and Santa Monica etc and great for shopping over at Macys and Loewmans. The room looked out on the central courtyard and so it was quiet and you could open a window for fresh air. The room was not large but it was fine for the price and there was valet parking. Heaps of places to eat and shop within walking distance. We had a night at the end of our trip before flying out of LA and tried to book it at Elan but they were full! So we booked at the Sofitel down the road - much more expensive and very noisy - not worth the extra size in room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great service, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: jwclevelander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Elan as part of a week long trip down the California coast prior to dropping off our son for his freshman year in college. We chose Elan based on Trip Advisor recommendations and we were not disappointed. The location of the hotel is excellent and was a quick drive to some of our sight seeing destinations such as the Santa Monica Pier and Disneyland. The rooms were pretty spacious. The decor was a bit dated and the carpet somewhat worn, but everything was clean and well taken care of. The water pressure in the shower was fine, something I'm always particular about. The hotel offers free wi-fi and the connection seemed faster than most hotels. Complimentary breakfast is served in the lobby and was decent, offering cereal, yogurt, pastries, coffee and juice. No hot food like eggs or pancakes. The hotel service was outstanding. For example, I left my Blackberry charger at the prior hotel. The front desk person asked around among the other service people and found someone with a charger so that he could charge my Blackberry with enough use until I could go out and get a replacement charger. The valet was very good with advice regarding some of the places we were visiting, including unsolicited (and appreciated) advice about wearing some warm clothing in the evening near the beach. Overall, a very sound and relatively economical choice of hotel. Would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Worth the top rating for sure”
Reviews.Author: Melsk1
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Elan during a 3 week trip around Western USA with one friend & stayed at various nice hotels through out our trip. Elan was our favourite. The customer service/staff are excellent - very helpful. The rooms have good sized bathrooms, are clean, the flatscreen tv has non pay tv - great as some hotels we stayed in were pay per view only! Free internet is another bonus. For those not familiar with travelling in the US without a laptop believe me it gets expensive in most hotels. There is a good complimentary breakfast in the morning as well as wine & cheese from 5pm - 7pm. It is a 5 minute walk to the Beverly Center & there is a 24 hour pharmacy/CVS across the road. I would return here in a flash & in fact very much hope to do so! Thank you Elan for making my trip to LA so enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “The perfect reviews say it all - this is a very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Beer_Club_for_Men
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff set standards; room was perfect, comfortable; I slept well and that's all I ask for. Breakfast was good - parking was arranged and I was even directed to a local dive when I asked. There is a good sushi cafe just up the road for a quick snack. A taxi was arranged in accordance which a special request I placed. As I said - everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Donna047
