The staff were genuinely interested in where we were from, what we planned to do for the day, and any particular requests we had. Yet they did not once become nosy. They know exactly where to draw the line. Also, every complaint we made (and yes, we did have a few minor ones such as asking for a tradesman to stop cleaning a carpet in a nearby room with a noisy machine while we were in our room) was answered with an apology and immediate attention and resolution of our complaint. Eg: When we rejected a Beverly Hills cab that they had called because a horribly scruffy, dirty looking man alighted from the taxi (he was the driver!!!) they called us another cab immediately and apologised. They did not criticise us for not caring about a scruffy cab driver or refusing to accept the cab. When the scruffy cab driver came into the lobby to ask where the passengers were, I heard the desk clerk say, "They (meaning us) changed their mind". He was pretty smooth! On our second stay in January we rented a car at the airport and the valet parking was perfect. We tipped every now and again and when we didn't tip (due to rushing) the man was still just as nice to us. The man who carried our bags to our room on arrival and from our room on departure was quick and attentive, and competent. Our bed was turned down each evening and the radio was on playing soothing music. There were small chocolates left on the bed for us each evening and a printed note relaying the next day's weather forecast. I had my laptop with me and so used the free wifi access which worked well. There was other internet access available for guests. The front desk staff will go to any lengths to help the guests with requests or complaints. The staff seem to really enjoy being in the hospitality game. Both my husband and I recommend this place highly for the superior front desk service and great location! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lessmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once in early December, '06 and again in early January, '07. Both times were great experiences and we'll not hesitate to go back again. The location is within walking distance of many excellent restaurants and shopping. A short drive will take you to the heart of Beverly Hills and all it's hot spots for shopping, dining and nightlife. I have to say that we've stayed in some of the world's finest hotels and the staff here at Elan was every bit as helpful, friendly and courteous as any five-star hotel we've visited. The property is in an older remodeled building. The rooms are cozy with contemporary fixtures throughout. But, this is not the hotel to choose if your plans are to cocoon yourself in your room. The rooms are neat and clean, but small. This is the hotel to choose if you are planning on getting out to see L. A. and all it has to offer. The nightly wine reception in the lobby is a great way to wrap a day of touring, business, and/or shopping. And, t's also a great way to kick off a night "on the town." This has to be one of Hollywood's best kept secrets. We love it and, as I mentioned above, we'll be back! We owe a great big 'thank you" to the extremely cordial staff at Elan!

Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel in a 5-star location”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_In_Taipei
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights in Elan early December with my husband as a post-surgery recovery stay before flying back home. Rooms => small, but the bed is great and large. Decoration is very simple and modern. Walls are too thin as usual, so you end up hearing your neighbor's conversation. Hopefully we were on the top floor. One big problem is the central air-conditionning system => it is very loud and noisy and you cannot switch it off in your room. So we had to change room and bought some tape and cartoon to fix it in front of the air opening. Value => I won't say the breakfast is free as advertised by the hotel as for sure they factored the cost into the room price. For information, we went to the Sofitel nearby and asked for the room price and it comes only USD 60 more expensive per night but you have a truly 5-star hotel service and amenities. So good value if you take the location into consideration. Extra => mandatory valet parking (by the way check your bill carefully as we rented a car for the 1st day only and they charged us valet parking = USD 15 for our entire 9 nights stay although we had no car anymore), a small but convenient gym with a TV and a PC free to use for hotel guests. Location => great location as we did not have a car. Walking distance of Beverly Center, Beverly Connection, Cedars Sinai Hospital, Farmers Market. I also took the buses to go around the area (Getty Center, Warner Studio Tour) and it was no problem at all. But don't count on the hotel to provide you this information as they won't have any idea. Instead go to www.metro.net

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Rach212
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a fairly inexpensive but decent place to stay in LA for 4 days. After reading loads of reviews about crabby and skanky hotels in LA, I was at a wits end until I chanced upon the reviews of Hotel Elan on Tripadvisor. Based on the raving reviews, we booked 3 rooms in Oct and were totally glad we trusted Tripadvisor.com once again! The Hotel Elan is a shining beacon in a sea of really expensive hotels and really crabby motels in LA. It may be a "higher-end" budget place or as some term it a "boutique" hotel, however what sealed our wonderful experience here was really the staff at reception. Practically everyone at reception was super helpful, friendly and took obvious pride in their work. They took pains to ask us each day where we intended to go, and unprompted, printed driving maps for us and gave us very clear directions - really helpful for us as we were used to driving on the other side of the road! We felt really welcome here and got great advice from the staff about places to go, restaurants and night spots. The rooms are nicely appointed, although on the small side. And as this used to be an old folk's home before it was given new life as a hotel, the hallways still retain an "old folks home" feeling. We had 3 rooms - 2 were small and faced the inner courtyard, 1 was at the end of the corridor and was distinctly larger. If you prefer more space for your rooms, ask for the rooms at the end of the corridors. The location was convenient as well, close to Sunset and Santa Monica Blvds, and it was easy getting to the major freeways. I loved the fact that I could walk to Beverly Center shopping mall, which was useful since I had a free day by myself whilst my friends went to Magic Mountain. I spent an entire day at the mall and walked back by myself after dark - it was quite safe. The free continental breakfast that comes with the room was more than adequate. The lobby area does get quite crowded during peak breakfast time, and like another reviewer pointed out, it gets really hot with the sun streaming in. We tried to get back in time for the free wine reception but alas, the sights of LA beckoned and we never did made it in time. Was a nice thought though. Overnight parking for our car was $14 in an underground garage - it was great to have a valet park it and bring it around in the morning. On our second day, the guy at reception recognised us and before we could request for our car, it was driven out whilst we were having breakfast - great service! Overall, we loved the Hotel Elan! I was especially relieved as I was i/c of booking the hotel for our party of 6. Thanks once again TripAdvisor! I never leave home anymore without checking out the reviews here!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the business !”
Reviews.Author: cquinn
Reviews.Content: Ok - this hotel is very good. Pro's: Good location: Near a big shopping mall. With plenty of taxis right outside. Very near to beverly hills - and a fantastic restaurant called fogoa de choi (brazillian steakhouse). Staff: They are very nice and always willing to help. Freebies: The breakfast is very good. Juice and tea/coffee. Cereals and loads of different pastries and fruits. The free red and white wine every night and this is nice wine by the way. Room: Medium sized room - spotlessly clean and cleaned daily. And a good shower. Internet - Free wireless access and also a free desktop internet connection too. Cons - I really cant think of any. Ok there is no swimming pool but what do you expect from a very fairly priced hotel. How can people not say that this is a great place to stay. Its just ideal. I used tripadvisor to book the whole lot of my 4 week honeymoon and i guarantee anyone that they will have a pleasant stay at the elan

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably peaceful place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: Sistinas
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in years, to visit my brother after he moved to LA, and spend Thanksgiving (and our birthdays) together. I had a huge fear of paying a ton of money to be treated like crap or have a bad experience, so I really sweated the hotel selection. I craved a modern decor and not a chain hotel, and leaned toward the Chamberlain for awhile, but eventually decided on the Elan thanks to the reivews on this site. I booked thru Travelocity and paid $155/night from Nov 19 to Nov 24, checking out on Nov 25. This was for the king sized bed suite. We could not have been happier with the entire experience. Though the room was not huge, it was perfectly adequate and comfortable for the two of us (and bro & gf) to lounge between activities. Dead quiet at night (we had a room off the back alley of the hotel), we slept great every night (wonderful linens). Only had the continental breakfast one day (6:30 to 10am) because we overslept the rest of the week. :D You had your choice of cereals, breads to toast, fruit, hardboiled eggs, juice and milk. And every evening from 5 to 7 was the wine and cheese tasting, which we frequented a lot more. :D We never got around to it, but you could also have massage in your hotel room. There is also a small work out room, but darn, never got in there either. ;P Did duck in once to use the business room computer for some directions, which we printed. Also, we had a balcony so the boys could go out and smoke...see pic...(all the other guest pix on this site have the rooms and other views covered) The staff was friendly and polite, especially Yolanda during check in. There is an ice machine in the basement right off the elevator, and several conveniences nearby. I joked that this hotel was my destiny, as there was a Taco Bell right across the street. We ate at Jan's Restaurant Sunday night because everything at Beverly Center was closed. Did finally break down one late night when getting back to the area, and got some Taco Bell. There is also the Mexican chain Alcupulco (sp?) and Norm's diner right around the corner. And to top it off, a gas station right up the street so we could feed our Pepsi/Mountain Dew fix in a town oversaturated with Coke products, and a drugstore right across the street from there, for all those little things we forgot. There is also a Jamba Juice, Baja Express and Souplantation right down the cross street (La Cienega I think). Do some exploring b/c there is plenty around the area, but it is nice and quiet at night so you can recover from the craziness that is LA during the day. When my brother moved out to LA, my dad spent $90 to stay in a Days Inn in the Studio City area, so I sure felt the Elan was worth it...despite the crazy drive over the canyon with my brother behind the wheel... I could not recommend it more, and would absolutely book there again if needing to be in the area...it was a great trip, and a lot of that was thanks to the cute little Elan Hotel Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: frocha
Reviews.Content: Can’t say enough good things about the Elan Hotel. Stayed there Nov 17 – 20 in a “junior suite”. The room was comfortable, very clean, and spacious. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There as a continental breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evenings. We would not hesitate to stay at the Elan in the future. Other items noteworthy, the hotel is across the street from a 24 hour restaurant and a Taco Bell. Not the best, but will do in a pinch if you get hungry late at night. The hotel is a block walk from the Beverly Center which is a huge shopping mall. In the other direction, you’re less than a miles walk to the Farmers Market. We even walked home from Rodeo Drive which was a little over 2 miles. Another plus is that the Starline Tours picks up at the Elan every morning at 8:35am and returns you when your tour is over. Again, don’t think you can beat the quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at the Elan”
Reviews.Author: moodster
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here at the beginning of November and found it very pleasant. Staff were welcoming and helpful, the room was fairly large and clean, with a comfy bed. Turndown service was a nice touch, with a weather forecast and Hersheys left on the pillow. Nice bathroom too. Continental breakfast in the lobby was fine. Valet parking was quick and easy. Only downside was the noise from the road but it didn't stop me sleeping. I would recommend this place for being clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and in a pretty good location for getting around LA.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Excells”
Reviews.Author: kangas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to L.A and stayed 3 wonderful nights at the Elan. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Elan when in LA, you will not be dissappointed. Location is great, access to all the tourist spots so easy - but most of all the service you will receive here will be second to none. Dave and Vance (front counter) Efrain (valet) you guys are the best and made our holiday !!! Will be back next year !!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: nammer21
Reviews.Content: Deserves all the praise you read. Nice modern rooms, free internet, nice morning breakfast, helpful staff, great location in the middle of Beverly Hills. All for a great price. Can't go wrong choosing Elan.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: NYC999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Nice accomodations. Clean, modern. Not too noisy. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: GJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan from 13th to 16th October and, as we liked it so much, returned there after our 5 day trip to Vegas for another 3 nights. Unassuming in appearance, the hotel scores heavily for its great location, spotlessly clean, classically designed and very comfortable bedrooms, and the friendliness of management and staff. Jorge and his colleagues on the front desk were a revelation with their untiring and enthusiastic help in recommending great restaurants, places to visit etc. And management were particularly helpful in letting us have a complimentary room post-check out to freshen up for our evening flight home after a long day enjoying the Southern Cal sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MHH1
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay at the Elan Hotel in September.Location is convenient for all attractions-walking distance to Beverly Centre and simple drive to Hollywood,Farmers Market and Rodeo Dr.There is also a great diner across the road (Jans I think)and superb sushi bar 100 yards from the hotel.Staff were very knowledgable and friendly.Breakfast nice and cheese and wine in late afternoon very welcome after long day sightseeing.This really is a great value hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Location & understated charm”
Reviews.Author: DublinEoin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Elan Hotel Modern for two nights on September 24th & 25th based on the high rating in trip advisor and its convenient location. We were not to be disappointed. We tend to try and stay in places that are value for money but as close to the downtown area as possible and the Elan is definitely both. It represents good value by L.A. standards and it is a good central location between hollywood & beverly hills and therefore is convenient to any part of L.A. you might like to see. The breakfast was simple but elegant. A constantly refreshed supply of bagels, pastries, cereals, coffee, juice, boiled eggs etc. It is taken in the lobby area which is very atmospheric with big windows and simple furniture. A nice touch was the computer room with free internet (one computer). The staff were very helpful in a non-pushy way especially as our luggage arrived a day after us. The valet parking was handy and feel it was decent value and certainly we were clear up front on the cost. The valet himself was a very helpful guy. The room we had was clean and had everything you would expect in a modern hotel room. I didn't find the area particularly noisey and there are definitly decent resaurant options within walking distance - in one we even spotted a genuine celebrity (Jason Alexander from Seinfeld).

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: intolerant
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel because of reviews and price. Nothing to be disapointed in atall. Staff were the nicest we met during our two weeks in USA. Restaurants close by and a four minute walk to the wonderful shops. The rooms were plenty large enough and so was the breakfast. We bombarded the receptionists with questions and they came up trumps every time. When we return to LA we would not consider staying anywhere else. A pool would be nice , we did more shopping in the spare time we had instead.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: sixfooteven
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Elan (Oct 6-9th). The staff was excellent, warm and considerate, they gave great advise and wanted to make our stay a lovely one. As for the hotel it was very clean, with lovely modern rooms and plush bedding and neutral colors. The room was a good size and we had a small balcony (201) that was nice. There is also a nice continental breakfast (whole fruit, cereal, breads and hard boiled eggs) and a wine and cheese hour in the evening. The hotel's location was wonderful, just half a block from the Beverly Center Mall (Hard Rock-Pf Chang and affordable shopping) we where also 10 minutes to the Sunset Strip (The Comedy Store and "celebrity owned" bars). Elan is a boutique hotel that works hard to live up to your needs and you feel appreciated. You get a lot for the great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elan”
Reviews.Author: SUSIEgir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for nine nights in Sept, and absolutely loved it. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The beds in the room were very comfortable. You can walk to the Beverly Centre and restaurants and local transport is only a short walk as well. We used local transport to get around without any trouble. Jan's Restaurant is accross the road, which is a retro kind of Diner, but the food is excellent and it is very reasonably priced. There is a Wine and Cheese held each night Mon-Fri from 5-7pm and the breakfast each morning is just what you need to get you going. Loved the Granola for brekkie, but cannot find it in Aussie. We were offered a room to use on the last day at no extra charge as we were not leaving the hotel until 7pm. I would definelty stay at the Elan again. Sue Weston - Gold Coast Australia

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: alcbkr
Reviews.Content: I do business with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and this is a reasonably well priced hotel for the location. It is within walking distance of the Center. I don’t like to drive when I’m in LA so the Elan’s location is ideal. Close to work and close to shopping, etc. I have always had a clean room on the second floor. I have liked the continental breakfast and have never had a problem billing, service, etc. Although the coffee really isn’t very good. Overall I rate them above average.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: screengoddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Elan Modern for 2 nights. Check-in was fine, and the staff were very friendly towards me. They gave me any help that I needed and suggested places for me to go and see. The hotel is very handy if you want to go shopping in the big malls, as there is one, just about a block away, with Macy's etc in. Parking is valet, which as it was my first time, took a bit of getting used to, but it was very safe, and there is also a petrol station about 100m away. Breakfast is in the price and consists of a range of yoghurts, fruit, pastries, bagels, and went from 6:30am till they said 10:30, but I wasnt around to notice when it stopped. They lady on the desk rang for a taxi for me one of the nights, and discussed eating places too. I was told about there being a wine thing in the early evening for guests, but I wasnt around to see it. I expect this did happen, though, so would have been nice to have a sit after the days sightseeing and discuss where to eat that night. The room was big and light, with high ceilings, tv/video, 2 phones, i had a patio onto a small courtyard, but the rooms higher up had balconies too. The rooms were nice and quiet, and were very clean. I put on my do not disturb sign when the cleaner was coming round, and she didnt come in, but later on in the day, she did another round, of the ones missed off, which means you can still sleep in, and have a change of towels! The interenet was free (in the business room) and there was a safe in each room too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jasonmelb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week long stay at the hotel. Could not fault it in any way. The staff, Location, Price.. I don't think it is possible to do any better. Miss it already, will return in 2008. Jason (Melbourne, Room 108)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Daso
Reviews.Content: If there is a hotel you want to stay at, then this hotel should be it. First of all, it is situated in the middle of everything. Most shops are within walking distance. The staffs service is Exceptional. The staff were advising us what to see and where to go. They Booked all of our tours. As for our last day there, the water boiler broke and we did not have hot water for about half an hour. So the management decided not to charge us for the food and drinks we took from the room fridge, which was about US$30. We had a flight that night, so the Management let us stay for free the extra few hours, giving us a new room so we can shower and relax before our flight. I rate this hotel 10/10 and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: sm16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for one night on the 29th August and although we had read the reviews which were positive for some reason we didnt no what to expect and a bit unsure. How wrong you can be!!!! Firstly I can confirm the staff are very friendly and helpfull. We asked for directions, advice on the area, local restaurants and they did all they could to help. Room was nice, clean and the bed was a nice large one. They had wine and cheese in the early evening which was a nice touch - you can help yourself to as much as you want. Breakfast was continental style in the main reception area which was well laid out and had plenty of choices. As a tourist it was well located near the Beverly centre and a short drive to Hollywood Blvd (chinese theatre park in the new shopping mall and get a discounted ticket), and a short drive to Rodeo Drive. Wish we had stayed a bit longer but will definatley use this hotel if we stay around the area in future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff and very well located!”
Reviews.Author: Salva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elan Modern with my wife one night on August 28th. The hotel is good and the staff was really nice and very helpful. The room was very clean and the bed really wide. We had Internet free (wired&wireless) and the breakfast included in the price. It is also well located, one block away from Beverly Center. I strongly recommend this hotel (very good relation between quality and price).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Beardtours
Reviews.Content: Booked on the back of the positive reviews and wasnt disappointed. Given its location and features this place is really good value for money. The room was big and comfortable with a clean modern layout. The staff were helpful and friendly. Great location, theres some good restuarants, and the Beverley centre within walking distance. By car you can hit all the main sites pretty easily, congestion aside! If I come back to LA this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Elan”
Reviews.Author: captainI
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Elan. The staff provided excellent service. The rooms were neat and clean. The property was centrally located within a few miles from Holleywood, LA, and West LA. The Breakfast was plentyful and the hotel is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyToronto
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days in Las Vegas my family and I needed some good old fashioned West Hollywood 'down time'. I found the Elan Hotel by chance online when looking for accommodations for our stay. What an absolute jewel! Walking distance from The Beverly Center, Melrose Avenue, and the Sunset Strip, we could not have picked a nicer, more pleasant place to stay. We arrived late and the front desk manager kept the complimentary wine and cheese out JUST FOR US! The entire hotel staff from room service to the guy parking the car were so incredibly friendly and helpful (helped us find our way around and even suggested places for dinner..). The bedrooms were so inviting and immaculately clean (loved the mints on the pillows) and the bathroom was spotless! (unfortunately no pictures to post...) We'll definately stay here again - it was an absolute delight. Best wishes to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: AvineshB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern from July 15 through July 19. To our surprise, we were upgraded to a king-size bed from our double bed on check-in. That saved us $34 a night, while allowing for room to sleep. The bed is a bit on the hard side, but still comfortable. Down comforters were included, which were a bonus. The minibar in the room was fully stocked, as was our fridge. However, you will find that going to the Rexall Drug Store down the street will save you quite a bit on food and other items. The close proximity to the Beverly Center was a plus as well -- about a 5 minute walk. Beverly Center features a number of stores on four floors, and also quite a few fast foot restaurants on the top-most floor. There's no DVD player in the room -- just a TV/VCR unit. However, they allow rental of a handful of movies from the front desk (didn't use). The room itself was very clean and to our surprise, classical music was playing each day we returned from our sightseeing adventures. The chocolates on the bed and the weather forecast for the next day were also a nice added touch. Breakfast was great with plenty of items to choose from -- bagels, cereal, milk, orange juice, pastries, coffee and toast. Free wireless and wired Internet usage was a bonus. The staff at the Elan were very friendly, from greeting us to ensuring that our taxi service arrived on time (they yelled at them a couple times on our behalf). They offer a private, executive car to local attractions and the airport. Taxi service will be cheaper in almost all cases, unless you want the added foot room and luxury. Restaurants in the area: Jan's (good, cheap food) and Vegan Glory (good chinese vegan food). Will stay here again. A very, very good value relative to other similar hotels in the area. Perfect location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: millypoppymo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, rooms to a very high standard. Staff were very professional and attentive. Breakfast buffet lovely. There are some good restaurants very near by, including an excellent vegan restaurant. Also very close by is the Beverly Shopping Center.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Modern..GREAT”
Reviews.Author: fish3d
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Elan for three nights. July 15, 16 17. I have never met a more attentive and nice staff in all my travels. We were here on business and the wireless internet and conference room was a great plus. The breakfast served in the lobby made our stay even easier. The coffee was fantastic. Our room ( # 105) was very quiet and had two double beds. There are literally dozens of excellent restaurants within a few minutes walk. The guests were an eclectic group and all were nice and friendly, I think the hotel attracts those types. Again the service was outstanding and the rooms extremely comfortable. We plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Hotel Perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On last June we stayed for two nights on a triple room at Elan Hotel Modern. This hotel is fantastic. Very clean and modern rooms, very nice staff (front desk, valet parking), big bathroom, even for three persons in the room. The location is also a point. Walking distance from Beverly Center Mall and close to lot's of attractions. For sure we'll stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great HOtel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Elan employees (especially Yolanda, Paulo, David and David) were wonderful. Anytime I had a question or needed directions, they were able to assist. The staff went above and beyond their duties to make my vacation enjoyable. They truly cared about what activites were we doing for the day and offered tips. The rooms were clean and nice. The hotel was located in a central location for many tourist attractions. Thanks to the Elan employees, you have a great hotel. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: paullv
Reviews.Content: My family went to California to celebrate my daughter's birthday and go to the American Girl Place at the Grove. The Elan Modern was a short distance away so we decided to stay there. Everyone on the staff was very friendly. The rooms were small but very clean and quiet. The location was excellent. In L.A. you definately need a car to get around. It is within walking to the Beverly Center shopping and a short drive to Hollywood. On our next trip to L.A., I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Elan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Elan for a week in April. My son-in-law booked it for us, so We had no idea what we would get. We loved it and would stay again any time we are in LA. The room was extremely clean and and pleasant. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was more than enough for anyone. The location was great for shopping or sight seeing. We always felt very safe there, and that is important for women traveling alone. The bedding was so comfortable, it felt like home. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find In Tinseltown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this small hotel online and booked directly with the front desk. The staff is well-trained and very helpful. They provided excellent directions and were very knowledgeable about the best places for shopping and dining. The hotel is very clean and the sheets and towels were top quality. I need high speed Internet access and the Elan provides wired and wireless Internet at no charge. They also include a free continental breakfast and overall this is a great value in a very nice part of Los Angeles. My wife likes to shop and she loved the location and felt very safe walking around the neighborhood. We checked several other hotels in this area and most were over $200 per night. I would recommend to business and leisure travelers. Not good for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Elan in late February. Location was great. There were restaurants,Beverley Centre,laundrette, shops, all very close. Public transport was very accessible. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and courteous. The rooms were quite nice and clean. Bathrooms were good. The free internet was a godsend. The breakfast area next to the lobby was excellent with the morning sun beating in. The continental breakfast on offer was ideal with bagels ,cereals ,tea & coffee, fresh fruit. We had a very pleasant stay and I would highly recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Would return without question”
Reviews.Author: Texas-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern in January. We were in town for the Rose Bowl. After much looking we settled on the Elan based on customer reviews in Trip Advisor. We were extremely happy. The big differentiator was the service. I had a major migraine coming into LA and after getting our rental car we headed to the hotel at noon, 4 hours before check-in. We shared our concern that the rooms facing the street were noisier; the clerk took us to see each of the available three rooms and we took the one that suited us. In every instance when we asked the front desk folks for something, they were gratious, even going beyond the call of duty to retrieve milk for my wife at 1:00am. Our room was nicely appointed with one of the more comfortable beds I can remember in a hotel. It was a really great stay in a great location. The fact that Texas won the game made the weekend even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: What a great business hotel for the price… Called ahead and got a corporate rate of $150 and I must say, I was really pleased with this place. Great location, minutes away from Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, etc. Rooms are fine, not overly spacious, but generally well appointed. Nice, comfortable bed with quality linens. Good bath ammenities. Shower wasn’t awesome but decent water pressure. Service was very effective. Valet parking—a must—only took mnutes for car to appear…Room rate includes free wireless internet(!), a good quality continental breakfast and a wine and cheese reception every evening. If there is anything lacking, it would be due the size. Because the hotel is small (~50 rooms), there is no bar or room service…but personally I prefer the cozy nature compared to over-priced, mediocre hotel food. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, curteous front desk”
Reviews.Author: showshow57
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right across from Beverly Center shopping center. Our room was small, and there was a spot in the room, where everyone in my family felt dizzy. Very strange. But not enough to complain. They have red/white wine and cheese reception in the evening. Too bad they did not have any soda or water for the kids, and they were not very quick to restock the food. The morning breakfast was quite good with fresh bagels, fruit newtons, and cereals. The workers are all in suits and very curteous.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews were pretty spot-on”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Elan Modern in mid-December after reading all of the previous TripAdvisor reviews and deciding we could deal with what seemed to be the one or two persistent negatives and the plethora of positives. After staying at the Hotel Elan for three days I can definitely say it's a great, clean, safe hotel that is a bargain if you can get it for under $100 a night. The positives: the desk staff and cleaning staff are beyond helpful. They were 100% courteous and polite. Any time we had a question (even at 3a.m.) they found an answer quickly and professionally. There was not one time during our stay when they were less than completely professional and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was good and included; cereal, yogurt, bagels, bananas, apples, muffins, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, juice, and milk. There was always plenty of food as there is a dedicated staff member who cleans up and keeps things stocked. The room was clean, well-stocked, and in line with the 60's mod decor of the rest of the place. The not-so-positives: Parking - parking is something like $2 an hour with a maximum of $14 a day. There is NO PARKING around the hotel other than a few two-hour maximum meters. If you stay here and have a car, you have to do the valet thing. It's not that big of a pain but it's not exactly a huge positive. Basically you park your car in front of the hotel (for a maximum of 24 minutes) and one of the hotel staff takes the car and parks it in a garage. When you need your car you just call downstairs about 10 minutes prior to leaving and they'll have it waiting for you. They do not expect tips, although I did tip the guy who did most of the parking when we left. The first time I tried to tip he seemed like it surprised him to be given a tip, so I just didn't do it again until the last day, and only then because he had been so helpful in getting our car at weird hours and over and over again when we would come and go. The rooms - the rooms are very clean, no problems with that, and they are a little small (not as small as some of the previous reviews made it seem), but you can see some wear-and-tear on things like the comforter and headboard on the bed. It's not a big deal but we just took the comforter off of the bed since there were ample blankets and sheets underneath it, all of which were spotlessly clean. The only real complaint I'd have about the room is you can seriously hear everything in the room next to you. There were two old ladies next to our room who talked on the phone a lot and you could clearly hear their conversation. You could also hear the tv when it was on, and I don't think in either case they were being loud, the walls are just thin. It didn't bother us, but I could see how someone would be bothered if the room neighbors were a loud bunch. Location - there is a Taco Bell and Good Will across the street, a tire store next door, and a few restaurants within walking distance. The Beverly Center is within walking distance but there's not much else you would want to walk to. It's LA so you should have a car anyway, and most things were within a 10-15 minute drive. Overall, the Hotel Elan Modern is a nice place to stay with a courteous staff and clean rooms. The only things that might bug you are having to deal with the parking and the walls being pretty thin.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to Elan!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Elan was a great choice for our 3rd anniversary stay of 4 nights! We got a decent rate online, about $590. I goofed up and left my entire itinerary at home, but staying at Elan made our vacation a breeze. All of the employees were courteous and helpful. We were given a map upon check-in that we used thoughout our trip. The hotel is ideally located in Beverly Hills, close to Bev. Plaza, Rodeo Dr, Universal, Hollywood, the airport, etc. The ammenities were good for the price and very clean. Pay for the king bed...it's worth it! Parking is valet only and is $15/day. Continental breakfast was a good touch. We LOVED LA and will return and recommed Elan in the future (unless we upgrade to a luxury hotel). Next time we'll stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jurimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and would stay there again as well as recommend it to friends. The hotel was great in terms of location, staff friendliness and all of the amenities available. The complimentary breakfast had a wide variety of choices, not like some offered at other places. It surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: novacc
Reviews.Content: The Elan is in West Hollywood, a great location. It's a funky, modern hotel with reasonable rates. They have valet parking, but we were always able to find metered parking right out front of the hotel. Loved the free Internet access in the business center. The complimentary breakfast was more than I expected with cereal (they put out the GOOD ones!), hard-boiled eggs, various breads, and fresh fruits. While the complimentary wine and cheese in the evening did not offer a huge selection of wines (1 merlot, 1 chardonnay), it was a nice touch. Our room (a standard double) was clean and comfortable. Despite being on a main street, it was very quiet. The bathroom was very spacious with modern fixtures, and the shower was awesome! Great water pressure and temperature. Robes were available, and the bathroom gels and shampoos smelled really nice. The beds had soft duvets and comfy pillows - not too hard, not too soft. The staff could not have been nicer. Rob, the concierge, was a big help with activities and restaurant reservations. This hotel is a great value. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Blondie247772
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, with main routes through L.A. easily accessible and in a more commercial / residential area than a lot of hotels. The room was spacious (the bathroom was enormous) and both were clean. A buffet style breakfast is included in the room price and served in the lobby. If you bring a car with you, you'll need to pay the valet parking charge as there is nowhere in the vicinity to park your car on the road. The staff were courteous and efficient. I would definitely consider staying here again if I were to return to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Simple elegance - An oasis in LA”
Reviews.Author: BridgetF
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a hotel where people treat you with kindness and respect and you have a nice, clean, cheery room with high ceilings and simple clean designs, the Elan Hotel Modern is for you. It is the ultimate in convenience - business center, free internet, free breakfast and afternoon snack, nice workout room, super quick valet service and fantastic location where you can actually walk to interesting things! The rates are very reasonable in a neighborhood that has some expensive hotels like Le Meridien and Sofitel. After many years of looking, I am so happy to finally have a home away from home in LALA land at the Elan Hotel Modern!! Thank you tripadvisor for pointing me to the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of September. We spent ages trying to find a suitable hotel in LA. Every time we found one we liked most of the reviews weren't good. having read the reviews for this hotel we were initially unsure but it seemed to be in a good location for the things we wanted to do. We needn't have worried it was lovely staying here. We had a second floor room to the side of the hotel and it was perfect. You hear a slight noise from the traffic but nothing that bothered us. The room was clean and well presented. Each night we returned to the room the bed was turned down and the light and the radio were on. Also on each bed was a little note with a cartoon on it and telling us the weather forecast for the next day with 3 little chocolates. Nice touch. Breakfast was great. Cereal, rolls, bagels, bread, yoghurt, eggs, fruit, tea coffeeand orange juice. Just fine to start the day rather than going out searching for breakfast. The wine and cheese reception was all very informal and fine to have at the end of the day on returning to the hotel. However it is from 5 to 7pm and may be a bit early for some. This was a perfect location for visiting Hollywood, Universal (only about 20min drive) and Santa Monica. The Beverly centre is just two blocks away. There is a 24 hr pharmacy nearby which sells a bit of everything. There are also several restaurants in the near vicinity. The staff were all very helpful and Pablo one of the car valet staff was always so cheery. The only negative thing I would like to mention was that the matress cover was loose and the bottom sheet on the bed was rather short and I had to remake the bed each night to make it comfortable. All in all we fully reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: aquadotto
Reviews.Content: Read the June 2, 2005, review which is a very accurate description of this excellent little hotel. The only thing I would add is how impressed we were by the professional and courteous service. Stayed four nights and didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Cried when I left”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after a whole lot of internet searching and checking up on places on TripAdvisor....and, it is wonderful and consistent with most of the reviews you'll find here with the exception of a few disgruntled guests. This hotel has no grounds, and, it is basically just a gray building on a corner. If you're into the "outside" of a hotel, there's nothing to see here. However, the lobby is gorgeous and sun-filled. Despite what other reviewers have written, the front desk staff ranges from very acceptable to most excellent. Nate, in particular, was very helpful and sweet to us, even when he was not being tipped. He and other staff printed directions for us, gave advice, and catered to our every want and need and never stuck their hand out. Now, on to the room. The room was smaller than it appeared in the online photos, but, I quickly got used to that. We had a king sized bed, and, that was the most wonderful part of the experience--gorgeous, white, sparkling clean, long-staple high thread count cotton sheets, a double-sheeted down comforter, four gorgeous down pillows. Once you were in the bed, you didn't care how big the room was. The furniture and the carpeting in my room was just fine and seemed relatively new, with three deep drawers for my stuff, as well as a full sized closet with some California-Closets-type shelving, and, a small safe that you set a four digit code to get in and out of, for your laptop, camera, extra cash or whatever. I thought the bathroom was much nicer than "some couple's first apartment" although it was not extravagant at all. Nice and clean, nice black marble sink counter, very acceptable amenities. Wolfgang Puck coffee was available in room and also in the lobby during breakfast, which was pretty good--cereals, bulk granola, milk and juice, fruit, pastries, bagels, coffee...in the gorgeous, well lit lobby which had a funky retro feeling without anything being old or run down. There were plenty of lovely white cotton towels, and, a nice white robe for use in the room. The television was very whatever, I confess I didn't watch it--why bother? You're in California! I was in a ground floor room on the back, and, I recommend that. It was quiet and nice. The sliding glass doors opened onto....nothing, just a wall....but, it was still a nice place to get a breeze and sit Indian style with a book and soak up a little morning sun with your coffee. The carpet was clean, the room was cleaned daily and the radio left on softly to nice classical music. I requested that my bed be made, but, my sheets NOT be changed....because it would have been wasteful. You can request that. Anyway, we had a wonderful time at the Elan, and, I'd move in there if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Style”
Reviews.Author: PT1976
Reviews.Content: This place was an awesome slice of LA style - cool colors, funky, laid-back. Not cookie-cutter at all - this place was not a chain and it didn't feel like you could be anywhere except LA. We booked a package through them for 360 total which included two nights, museum tickets, fanastic fresh breakfast, and $60 towards dinner at a nearby trattoria. The breakfast was hands down the best complimentary hotel breakfast I have ever seen - granola, wheat bread, bagels, real bakery pastries, fruit, fruit, fruit, great coffee. Bed was super-comfortable with high thread count linens. Bathroom was tiny but acceptable, bathrobes a nice touch. Common areas looked like they were either being renovated or in need of renovation but all in all, the Elan puts money into important stuff (bed, linens, funky decor, breakfast) and as for the rest, who cares if the hallway looks a little shabby. Finally, the front desk was phe-nomenal. I'm not usually a P.I.T.A. but I was without a car in LA and wanted to go to off-the-beaten-track places like Japantown and they helped me find bus routes to these random places even though they didn't know where they were - which means they took the time to research my P.I.T.A. requests - all with a smile. Finally, on the last night, I had planned to use my restaurant voucher but the place was closed on Monday nights and the front desk scored me a voucher to another restaurant even though we didn't make reservations like we were supposed to. They also arranged our super shuttle for us and had them wait for us when we were tied up at dinner. These people gave us 5-star service for a 2 star price. If their manager is reading, Jorge and Jordan deserve a raise. They were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Opaque but not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: After I read the reviews of the Elan on Trip Advisor and in several publications, I expected an incredibly hip hotel experience. Perhaps my expectations were too high certainly considering we didn't pay a whole lot. The room was rather bland filled with IKEA type furniture. Perhaps this where the "hip" quotient arrives from. Yet, this furniture is not holding up well and is showing signs of wear and tear. The bathroom was styled nicely in an inexpensive manner and looked like something a young up and coming couple would have in their first apartment The staff was friendly in that L.A. way letting you know that this hotel job is just temporary until their acting skills are discovered. The entire hotel experience was rather opaque reflecting on the entire hotel's ambience. The neighborhood is not too bad, within walking distance of Melrose etc. But, I forgot, nobody walks in L.A.! We were rather incongruous as we strolled down Beverly Blvd. If you can get a really low price, the Elan Modern Hotel is not too bad. It's just rather opaque.........Whatever that means.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: Catullus1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent domestic and international travellers who have visited LA often in recent years. After an extended cruise we just spent three thoroughly enjoyable nights at the Elan Modern and cannot be more positive in our evaluation of the establishment and its services. This is a terrific boutique-style hotel at a great location for dining, shopping, night life and just getting around LA. Our very spacious room with king size bed and large bathroom was tastefully decorated in muted tones with fixtures and furniture of Art Deco/Moderne design. A nice touch was the availability of a local restaurant listing delineated by ethnicity, location and price, complemented by an abundance of recent periodicals reviewing current tourist attractions and museum shows, as well as additional dining and shopping possibilities. Bedroom and bathroom linens and toiletries were of the highest caliber and a DSL connection (which we did not need on this occasion) was available in the room, while internet access (which I did use) and a printer (handy for keeping directions to the Getty and other tourist attractions) were available in the lobby's business center/lounge. The hotel's clientele was quite diverse: straight couples, gay couples, business people and singles. With West Hollywood nearby the hotel was clearly gay-friendly. Valet parking was swift and efficient ($14.50 per 24 hrs.), with its own underground garage which minimized waiting time (almost none). The included continental breakfast was a cornucopia of choices: hot and cold beverages, fruit, cereals, eggs (hard boiled), toast and muffins. The services of the front desk and the housekeeping staff could not have been more friendly, welcoming, courteous and helpful. The management of the Elan Modern clearly understands the tastes and needs of its clientele and delivers the goods. This a a fabulous find! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Area”
Reviews.Author: SLTravels
Reviews.Content: I chose the Elan Hotel Modern based on glowing TripAdvisor ratings, its proximity to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, and its value-pricing for its location. I ended up having mixed feelings about my experience there. The good points are that service is excellent. Staff goes out of its way to provide your every need. I appreciated the Business Center with its computer and printer that allowed me to check my office e-mail without charge and without dragging my laptop through airport security. The hotel has a nice exercise center, too. The location is close to the shopping of Beverly Center and Farmer's Market, and Museum Row, among others. The hotel provides breakfast (breads and cereals, fresh fruits, hard boiled eggs) and a cheese/wine reception on weekday evenings. The rooms have down comforters, which would be nice on chilly nights. They're not stingy with their plush pillows, plus there are extra pillows and blankets in the wardrobe. What Orbitz didn't tell me about was the mandatory valet parking at $14.50 per day plus the obligatory tips. Add this cost to the room price when you do your comparison shopping. There is no on-street parking available in this area, and no off-street parking except the valet basement garage. The rooms were small, the window couldn't be left open due to street/airport noise, and I could distinctly hear the snoring (and conversations) of my next-door neighbor. I feel fortunate that I didn't get treated to any other nocturnal sounds from the room next door. In this caliber of hotel, I expect better sound-proofing. The room had a refrigerator, which is always welcome. Unfortunately, it wasn't plugged in when we arrived. I had to pull it out of its cabinet to discover that the electrical outlet was expected to service the TV, the fridge, and the desk lamp. No other outlets are nearby, so you have to choose which one you're willing to live without. If you need to stay in this area, the Elan Hotel Modern is still a better price than nearby hotels such as the Sofitel -- but if your travel plans allow you the option of choosing a less-pricey area, there may be other hotels you like better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic style, privacy and convenience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern on Beverly Blvd., in Los Angeles, near Bevery Hills. It was within walking distance of the Cedars-Sinai Hospital complex and the decorating district on Beverly, and within a short drive to Hollywood, Sunset Blvd, and La Brea. The styling inside and out is a delightful modern version of the late 1950s-early 1960s. The accomodations are all one needs, with an emphasis on privacy. Continental breakfast was delicious, and the staff was both friendly and accommodating. The facade is modest and inconspicuous, and is thus a perfect spot for one seeking to be in town without a lot of attention. Evidently, Matt Damon selects the property for that quality, and I would agree. Prices are reasonable, esp. for LA. My expectations are simple, and set low by too many nights in hotel rooms that all appear the same, down to the TV remote. This hotel will make you comfortable, not cost you too much, and you will feel you are in a memorable place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Aims for style but wins on substance”
Reviews.Author: JohnInLouisville
Reviews.Content: To paraphrase a prior review, you may very well indeed think “uh-oh” at first sight of the Elan. The hotel is pretty small, and although they’ve updated the place to give it a hip vibe, it’s still pretty easy to discern that the building itself is getting on in years. When we were greeted promptly at the curb by a friendly valet, however, and then by the professional front desk staff, our minds were soon put at ease. Although our deluxe king room was on the small side, it was quiet, clean, and comfortable. The somewhat overwrought décor of the hotel’s public areas thankfully did not extend to the rooms which were still modern in design but more subdued. Even though our room was facing Beverly Boulevard, we were not kept awake by traffic noise save for an occasional siren (the hotel is a few blocks from Cedars Sinai Medical Center) which I doubt even the best soundproofing technology could have stifled. Linens were of high quality and soft; bed was firm. The closet comes with lots of shelf space which was so useful! Could hear some occasional chatter coming from an adjoining room but nothing too disrupting. Bathroom was small but adequate—for some reason we seemed to have problems with water splashing up and pooling on the basin’s countertop. The lobby’s retro-modern design came across as a bit cold and echoey; carpeting would have helped. The floor-to-ceiling windows were compelling but offered little more than a view of the Taco Bell across the street. The continental breakfast served in the lobby was akin to what you might get at a Hampton or Best Western which, for us, was preferable to gorging on pancakes and eggs every morning anyway. Free internet access in the small business center right off the lobby was handy for checking e-mail or printing boarding passes. The elevator was slow and a little crude. Hotel’s hallways were a bit dark and narrow. The location of the Elan is good. The hotel’s small size makes stepping out of your room and going places a snap, unlike larger hotels which sometime require an act of Congress just to reunite you with your car again. Beverly Center shopping and restaurants are only a 2 or 3 block walk away. Several other decent restaurants were within walking distance. There is also a huge Rexall drug store a block away for all those items you forgot to bring with you on your trip. Beverly Hills, CBS studios, and all the Hollywood attractions are a 5-minute drive—10 minutes tops. My companion and I did manage to walk to West Hollywood from the hotel, which is quite a trek but manageable if you’re up to it. (I suggest taking Beverly to Robertson rather than walking straight up La Cienega to Santa Monica Boulevard should you decide to walk it. It’s a shorter and a much more pleasant stroll.) All in all, once we got past the facility’s age and some of the cheesy décor, we really liked the Elan. Service and amenities alone made our stay a good deal for the money. We’d definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: given the cheap rates and the location, i thought this place would be disappointing. not at all! the room was exceptionally clean-- with taste, good design, and a thoughtful approach (including high speed internet in the room, good soap/shampoo in the bathroom, unoffensive decor... i usually hate hotel rooms). the linens were cool. the room was quiet, fresh, well lit. it's on a busy street lined wtih taco bell and other multinationals, but if that doesn't bother you it actually has a good location, near all of the places you might want to see in beverly hills. it's quick to get a taxi. from what i could tell, there were no good bars or restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but i didn't really spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Elan is a great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ATX-HOU
Reviews.Content: Normally, I stay at the Westin. This time since we were on vacation and staying 5 days (and on a budget)...I thought I would try out this place. The other reviews were not that bad, so I took a chance. I am so impressed!!! If you like great service, a good breakfast, wine in the evening and very nice rooms - all included in the price of your stay then this is the place for you! The people are so nice, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are clean. It is cozy, centrally located and the valet is so fast:) Getting in and out of the hotel is just so easy. I recommend this place - this place can not dissapoint! I would come back everytime I come to L.A.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Elan, and once again I was very satisified. The staff is very helpful, but free parking would be nice (it's an additional $14.50). The hotel was nicely decorated and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret of Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Scot_Wha's_Away
Reviews.Content: As your taxi draws up outside the Elan Modern, you could be forgiven for thinking "Uh oh!". But behind the worst-of-the-sixties architecture lies a little gem of a hotel with a level of service and the kind of personal touches usually reserved for the most expensive upscale chains. The hotel plays subtly on that sixties look throughout its very 21st century operation: the reception staff are dressed in fawn suits and crew neck sweaters; the lobby is furnished in modern retro; even the name evokes the era of Englebert Humperdinck and Frankie Vaughn. The rooms are a real pleasure. There are only about 20 of them, on two floors, and they are furnished in relaxing creams and browns. Toiletries are top quality, and are presented pocketed in folded towels. A dressing gown hangs on the bathroom door. There's a minibar and a stock of snacks, but you're unlikely to go hungry, because the Elan Modern includes a buffet breakfast in the very reasonable price: cereals, eggs, bagels, muffins and yogurt without the usual $15 added to the bill. Now to what's not perfect. The rooms are centered around a little inner courtyard, and for inexplicable reasons, they leave a bright light on in the yard all night. This means your room is never dark, and in fact, I ended up hanging a bath towel over the top of the curtains to block out the glare. The obsession with bright light extends to the fitness room which is oppressively overlit; it's also pretty basic, but there's a proper gym just along the road if you want a more extensive selection of kit. Despite the irritations this hotel is hard to beat, whether you're a tourist or business traveller. The attractions of Beverley Hills - the shops of Rodeo Drive and the bars and restaurants of Santa Monica Boulevard - are just minutes away, and it's a short drive to the Hollywood hills and the film studios which are a must see for every tourist. You won't go wrong basing an LA visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place suits my needs for a stay in la. Clean fresh down pillows and comforters are a delight to find in this price range! (Relieves my fear of nasty chain hotel bedspreads.) No frills, other than the afore mentioned linens, but a lovely quiet cosy place to call home in a great location as a bonus. Highly recommend, and that is a compliment!

Reviews.Title: “Top Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and from the minute we walked through the door, the staff exceeded our expectations. They were always helpful and honest and went beyond their call of duty to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful and our rooms were always left immaculate. The free internet was also a nice bonus. If we return to LA we will definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Elan Hotel Los Angeles
HotelInfo.Address: 8435 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048
